Excellent game from PlatinumGames! I originally saw this release and thought "meh" then saw it was made by them and was suddenly interested especially since playing Metal Gear Rising: Revengence which was a great hack and slash.Pros: The combat is a nice mix of spammy attacks with the right amount of variety from different weapons to combos to learn and master.The humor and general situations are way way over the top. I was thinking "what the hell am I playing" more than once given how cheesy or crude the situation presented. The boss fights were a nice change between each other and very different overall. Multiple ways to play the game and lots of stats tracking for those who like to not take damage/get highest scores.Excellent story with many twists and turns.The ending of the game had me jumping out of my seat cheering!Cons: Could be considered corny/cheesy and over sexualized but I felt it really added to the gameplay and the whole story. You may not get all the weapons/items in your first playthrough unless you're actively looking for the hidden chests.The saves/checkpoints sometimes are few and far between on certain levels.Would be difficult to play on mouse and keyboard but personally never played a game like Devil May Cry without a controller.Would rate 9 out of 10 as one of my favorite hack/slash games.

Excellent game with a real feel of being an a wide scale war.Many ways to contribute to the war effort.Different ways to approach battle and carry different kits of weapons or roles.Great game when everyone works together.Obtained all my game time within a 2-3 week period of going on 10-15 hour gaming sessions. The game is truely a "another 5 mins" game.

Died to sickness, wolves, and falling off a 2ft rock but I'm bad according to the people I play with. Bought first month when game came out back in 2013 and in 4 years, the game is still very buggy with progress in some areas but majority the game feels just the same as it did in 2013. Very buggy with random issues like things disappearing from your backpacks. Status effects like Cold, Sick, etc don't usually show up. Random drops to 20fps or lower requiring restart.In comparison, Rust came out around the same time and it's development has done so much more in the same time period when Facepunch is(was) a smaller company than Bohemia. Uninstalled until 2020 when beta's released.

Excellent game. Big improvement over Limbo.Puzzles were just right in difficulty and it's quite the weird journey. Highly recommend buying on sale since you'll get max 5 hours out of it since there isn't a huge reason to replay.

Have played Total War since Rome II, I can say that Warhammer was a breath of fresh air to the series. There are small bugs mostly with the AI and things like Archers stop attacking randomly. The addition of the Vortex victory to the game is a welcome one giving that it breaks the general "expand and conquer" where you have to protect your home province throughout the campaign. It allows you to play it out at your leisure since you can ignore the Vortex and wipe out all other races. (Which may take awhile since the new map is HUGE)Worth the money now even if you want to wait out for the balance/housekeeping patches.

Excellent game with very satisfying gameplay mechanics. If you enjoyed Devil May Cry but didn't enjoy the bullet sponge enemies, this would be the game for you. Pros:Great sword gameplay with satisfying finishersStory is well done with many little easter eggsThe bosses are difficult but not impossibleNumerous customization options along with different weapons/movesets.Giant metal robotsCons:Stealthing missions is more difficult then it's worth but possible.Shorter than expected but the story isn't long and drawn out either.Would get on sale but the game has great replayability even at full price.9/10 overall with being one of my favorite hackin/slash games ever.

Telltale did an excellent job in delivering Walking Dead Michonne. The action scenes were much better compared to the previous games and the story came to a huge surprise on how it played out. Since it's much shorter than the other ones, your choices are much more unforgiving. 10/10 besides it could of been longer and recommend getting on sale.

Everyone writing reviews saying this game crashes constanly and that it runs terrible. The main issue that I've run into is a random crash while VSYNC is enabled. Otherwise, zero crashes. I've also had 1 issue where I had to reload a save(so save often) where a NPC didn't spawn in Fort Frolic. Game is basically a Graphically re-done verison of Bioshock with similar issues related to the first.Pros: Re-done verison of the orignal gamePlays excellent at 1080pCons:Mouse controls still slightly broken but fixable with guides. (Check Reddit)NPCS not spawning. (Happened once)Occasionaly crash when VSYNC enabled.Highly recommend a ControllerIf you're experiencing crashes then you need to Update graphics drivers to latest. Turn off SLI. Attempt playing without VSYNC. Ensure you're are on Windows 10 Anniversary, otherwise I can't confirm if not on latest updates. Confirm you're running latest Dirextx Runtime/C++.8320 4.2GHz290x 1060/1360. AMD drivers 16.9.1 Latest16GB RAMWindows 10 AnnverisaryUsed Xbox One Wireless controller as Mouse control was bad without modding. Same as original game.

Great puzzle game and was suprised giving it's low cost. It's short but well worth it.You basically connect/disconnect connections to succeed in removing all lines in the away. I'm not one for puzzle games but this one was a bit different.
Great game!

Yea just the first 20 hours in this game is enough to know its going to be another EPIC story and edition to Farcry.I have not disliked a single Farcry yet, every one has been an amazing adventure and incredible graphics to go with it.My fav is probably Farcry 4, it was so well structured, you just knew what and where you were logically all of the time and teh story was so logically chronological.Farcry 5 was good too, but not as well organised or structured, but New Dawn improves on that to a huge degree, its a very bright game, lots of pink etc, the graphics are second to none in gaming, the physic's improves with every farcry but Farcry doesnt have a huge amount of real physic play in it yet still, but the game itself is awesome, its just FUN, which is what games are supposed to be, fun.I played as a girl !Just to be different, my partner thinks its pretty funny Im now a short blonde chicky running around with an M60 like cannon !!!She kinda has a point but its FUN !!!!!Great game, grab a copy and get hunting, hard to beat the environments in Farcry, truly awesome maps in every game so far.

Finished game, had a ball, , its a real exploration game where you follow a story, end up in some pretty cool environments do some pretty funny stuff, slap some robots , murder a computer or two, stomp on some seaweed, and manya things. The ARC, the Arc the Arc the Arc, what to say, maybe the second game will be a follow on, as to what happens to the Human Species after thousands of years in space living in a Matrix as electrons lol, puts new meaning to Captain Electron !  Fun game overall, not overly packed with action, a couple of frustrating dark scene's, its more about thinking about your environment, the physic's of the game and how to find things, I would call it more of an exploration game, over action or horror, two spooky moments doesnt really qualify it as a horror show, Dying light 2 thrust much more adrenaline into my veins !But for exploration, use your mind to win games it really pretty good.I hope they do a sequel to the game, they could extend that story very easily.If you like exploring abandoned bases, ruined bases, advanced bases, space bases, under water bases, that wort of environment, then you will probably enjoy this game.

Not as good as the original, but still pretty awesome. Map is not as large, but its detailed and has new assets.As usual the quality of the game finish is excellent for an indie game developer, absolutely outstanding was how I rated the first game, this is almost as good, I found a few bugs relating to ore chunks not being possible to get them, stuck in rock face of cliff so that was frustrating when the scanner has a dozen of them lit up you can never retrieve, but thats the only bug I found in the entire game while playing it so as far as Im concerned the game is of an excellent quality.The story carries on from the original game, its not as well laid out, its order of process can get confusing but you end up at the same place eventually so its not so bad.If you dont love Marg in this game, your mentally sick LOL !She is a legend, and really made the story worth following, more interaction with her would have been utterly awesome but it was not to be, what you get though is pretty impressive, keep in mind this is an indie team coding this, and far bigger games with bigger budgets have produced far worse AI interactions in game, so well done to the dev team on that front.Heaps of people like to hate on this game simply because its not quite as good as the original, and because they expect every game to be built to their personal specifications, which I think is simply unreasonable.Some of the excuses include arguments about specific features, but all of that is just nit picking for the sake of making an argument.If you judge this game in a more scientific way, as a stand alone game, like everyone did for the first game, you get two great games that easily pass the mark to qualify as two of the best games on Steam outright.So ignore the haters, haters will always have more hate that empathy.I have I think about 1000 hours in both games separately and I thoroughly enjoyed both games, if only ALL indie dev teams could build games to this level of quality the Steam indie platform would have a much better reputation.So overall 8 out of ten, the first game I would rate at 9 out of ten to give comparison, Ive had a dozen or so folk contact me on Steam chat asking about the game so I drop this review for those and people of the future.I would rate Farcry 4 with a 10 out of ten, its AI is really cool.Just for rough comparison to a company with a AAA rating and a heck of a lot more recourse's to build games.To be competing with the likes of ubisoft or any other AAA company, being an indie developer, is an awesome achievement.But what really makes the Subnautica franchise rock the most is the fact its a focused SINGLE player game with a really good story that is pretty well laid out and what makes that so immersive are the data pads and the use of scripted parts of the game, cut scenes etc, and a heap of indie developers could take a lesson from that.I fully expect to see this story expanded on even more in the future, they may not have any games listed right now, but I see a continuation of this story in the future, I think the company would be crazy not to explore that and try to create a whole new planet map for that planet, in a different area of Alien tech not yet discovered, maybe humans discover a city for example and where that could take the story teaching us about heaps of the Alien history etc, but the door is wide open for a continuation of this franchise.I hope they do it, there level of quality in game development is really good for an indie team.Usually I would say wait for a discount to buy on Steam, but when the game is such a good effort, and good quality,  pay the full price, its worth it and it is not that much anyway at around 30 dollars.Highly recommend the game, great survival game, brutally hard in the sense that you have to do a lot of eating and drinking to stay alive, Ive played it in both modes, and I enjoyed both, but I did enjoy the second run through more on freedom mode, and I have about 600 hours in this one freedom game alone now, the first game raked up about 400 hours with food on, but I found myself rushing some things and not getting the most out of the exploration side of the game so just before the ending on teh first game I jump into a new game on freedom, not quite at finish yet so still have not seen the ending fully yet, pretty close though but it worked as a great incentive to want to keep playing, not quite finishing the game in full survival mode, mystery is the spice of life and once its answered the mystery is gone forever.Grab a copy of this game if your into survival games, forget that its underwater, I also thought for two years, nah that game is underwater how good can it really be, its  INCREDIBLE !I seriously regret my massive lack of insight on this, as a person of science that was really narrow minded of me, and I completely regret it and these developers have without a doubt changed my view on just how awesome a survival game can be, under water. I started looking at other games in the survival genre because of this game and the eye opening experience it gave me.Breathedge for example, brutal survival, not on a planet.....But it was Subnautica that open that door and Below Zero of coarse, So I can not recommend this game highly enough, along with the first game, and you should absolutely play the first game first, before playing this game, if your into stories, that how you should do it, in chronological order of the events.But do get a copy, developers like this we WANT on Steam, developers like this, deserve good sales and profits.If Steam had more developers that finish their games, with quality like the Subnautica franchise, Steam indie would have a great reputation, we all see a lot of hate on indie devs, because of vapourware which is understandable, but that is not these folk.One of my favourite games on Steam of all time.Thats a short list of a dozen.

If you like a game that drops you straight into the action, this game is that.The game is still in EA so lots to add and do finish etc, but for what it has already is action packed, and progressively gets harder.The game has really great potential and I hope to see it get developed for a few years and become epic.Im not sure but I think the dev team is a one man team so its pretty impressive that one guy did all of this if thats the case.I recommend the game not because I have heaps of hours, been to busy to play lately, but because the time I did play it was great fun.Its a cheap game also, so thats always a bonus.

Oh them Russians !!!Metro is a good fun game, a game with a story, lots of action, and its fun to play a game from the Russian perspective, I havent finished the story but so far its been pretty good, good graphics, good effects, character doesnt get stuck on everything lots of freedom to roam and explore, decent story and some rather weird stuff chucked in for good measure ! Not a zombie game but does have some zombie like features, overall a good game worth the price in my opinion.

OMG if you like funny, oh and chickens, buy this game !One of the best EA steam games out there, if your not laughing within 5 minutes of loading this game up, refund it, you obviously have no sense of humour !Classic funny start, think serious sam meets postal meets subnautica meets space engineers has a baby, Breathedge !Oh, and chickens.Did I mention chickens ? !If your a chicken lover, errm, maybe try something else !I looove chicken, tastes great !Oh, best watch out for those space Vegans too, hehehe, always have a spare chicken ready !

I really LOVE flying, so its hard to not recommend this game but, it has some drawbacks.War Thunder is a pay to gain an advantage game.Like many others now, trying this shifty system of  subscriptions etc, it seems pretty effective, I see people in purchased planes all the time and you dont stand much chance in a 1 on 1 with most of them as most of them have a much heavier 1 second burst from the guns / cannons, so you in a crappy plane , you have paid nothing to develop yet, man your such a victim in this game, that is , right there the definition of pay to win or pay to gain an advantage, a definition well established from the days of DOS to current day.Right, dont expect DCS levels of flight realism, totally different game, this game is the arcade version of flight sims, its brilliant in that regard.What it does do is give kids a much better understanding of a 3d environment, and parents alike, lol, and it brings people together in large games where your almost never facing the same set of players twice, everyone gets jumbled in that server matching system from what I can tell.Flying itself, for an arcade style game, is pretty damned impressive, I like that you can use a HOTAS joy or mouse or both and keyboard and all buttons Ive needed so far are bind-able, so thats a heap of great work in the backend of the game you dont usually see, done very well, almost perfect.The game does not feel quite the same on a joystick, I find myself often just playing in the lounge on second PC with mouse, while youngling also uses the mouse, always, but when you fly with the joy, its not quite as simple to aim, but its still pretty good.Just for pure fun, is a blast for say 2 hours a day, to get rid of that, I MUST FLY itch, lol, works wonders, that or you grab an RC plane / chopper like we have and hit the real skies !Overall  I like the game, hate the business plan, but they did such a good job on the game itself, its still worth playing just to experience the WW2 planes and great modelling.You can do all your planes up with custom paint jobs etc, you can buy with real money your countries own real flag for your planes etc.

Into Exploration ?Voxel building ?What about an awesome tech system and tier level up system , would you like that ?Maybe its performance your looking for ?Could it be a sci fi theme your thirsting for ?Do you like really pretty environments ?Do you like a challenge ?Do you have a GTX980 graphics card or better ?Answer yes to them, and this game is a gem for you.An absolute GEM !The performance for an EA title is just mind blowing , so many moving object over such a huge area all moving, its truly incredible to see.The level up system is fun, its intuitive and easy to learn, its a very well laid out game.One of the BEST voxel type explorer sci fi games Ive ever seen.I dont have many hours on Steam yet, but Ive owned this from day one on EPIC store and have several hundred hours in game.Thedetail in the models is awesome, the rsolutions are high and great, this game on a 4k 71 inch screen looks utterly fantastic in every way, I can not recommend this game highly enough.The devs are active and have a great sense of humour and even take the p_ss out of themselves.If you cant have a laugh in life, what are you even doing on Earth at all lol ! Support his game if you can afford it, its worth every cent, its an absolute work of true art.The finished product and finished story are not yet in, but updates are full on, big, full of content, open whole new lines of tech at every update so far.I cant wait to see what they come up with for the games mid and end game features / story.Highly recommend this game, really good fun, really well done, you simply will not find a higher quality game or programming than this in Steam EA.This game is actually miles better than, literally half of the AAA games Ive ever owned.Sometimes a real thing of beauty is created, this game is that in a nutshell.

DONT EXPECT A FINISHED GAME !This is a game that is brand new to Indie, its early days, but the game has pretty good complexity in its survival very few major bugs, some models low res some high res, this is what new indie games look like, this game has alot to it, has a tech tree, levelling system which is pretty good, good lush environment thats easy on the eyes, its alot to learn for new players because the survival side is more complex than most survival games, but if you stick with that initial steep learning curve you will appreciate the game alot more.Pretty much a one man dev team, and what an impressive first game to have under his belt.I recommend.Much fun !

Game looks interesting, only a small dev team so dont expect huge updates super fast, but its had over 70 updates and is still progressing, its an interesting take on the genre, I like it, so I give it a thumbs up.

The Witcher 3 : Wild Hunt. Un titre qui s'impose d√©sormais comme une sorte de r√©volution au sein des triples AA Actuelle.Sorti en 2015 par le studio CD Project,ce jeu nous emm√®ne dans une toute nouvelle √©pop√©e de Geralt de Riv,le boucher de Blaviken.La qu√™te principal est une v√©ritable histoire prenante,emmenant le joueur sur tout les coin de la carte ou d'autres intrigues pourront parfaire sont parcours avec des chasses aux tr√©sors,des qu√™tes secondaires bien √©crites ou bien d'autres petits √©v√©nements qui rendent le monde vivant et "r√©el",dissoci√© de Geralt qui interagit avec lui.Concernant le jeu en lui m√™me,il est tr√®s bien optimis√© sur PC,permettant de caper √† plus de 100 fps dans la plupart des lieux,les villes tr√®s vivantes comme Novigrad ou Velen pourront parfois nous faire l√©g√®rement baisser niveau FPS mais c'est tr√®s faible.Je conseille √©videmment une exp√©rience √† la manette m√™me sur PC,bien plus ais√© pour le confort de jeu mais les r√©glages clavier sont aussi tr√®s accessible !En r√©sum√©,The Witcher 3 a r√©ussi √† renouveler le mod√®le du RPG,donnant de nouvelles id√©es √† d'autres studios comme Ubisoft avec les AC Origins et Odyssey qui empruntent beaucoup de l'ADN du jeu.M√™me les DLC du jeu sont tr√®s complets et vous vaudront plus de 10 heures de jeux suppl√©mentaires ce qui est non-n√©gligeable.Ce jeu est un "Must Have",il m√©rite tout votre temps et votre investissement.Vous pouvez y allez les yeux ferm√©s

Ce jeu quel p√©pite,quand on m'as dis que l'√©quivalent d'un JDR entier exist√©..nous avons d√©cid√© des amis et moi de nous y ruer dessus !Nous ne sommes pas d√©√ßu du tout.Evitons de parler des sujets superficiel mais le jeu est beau,une belle petite claque pour les mirettes comme on les aimes !Les dialogues entres les personnages sont bien amen√©s et leurs √©critures est brillantes,on reconna√Ætras l'accent "Brittish" √©videmment mais les PNG ne sont pas l√† car nous sommes pr√©sents avec eux,ils ne sont pas d√©pendants de notre existence !Au del√† de tout √ßa il y √† la cr√©ation de personnage et OUla,la diversit√© de ce qu'on peut faire : Mage-Archer,Chevalier-Mage,Paladin et j'en passe et des meilleurs.Il ya  une r√©el libert√© de cr√©ativit√© et on se croirait vraiment dans un JDR ! Cette sensation agr√©able est agr√©ment√© par du Looting intelligent,du crochetage,de l'√©loquence..m'enfin des trucs assez anodin qui rajoute un c√¥t√© "RP" √† votre Aventure !Bref Divinity: Original Sin 2 c'est un voyage qui est quand m√™me mieux √† plusieurs ! Bandits,H√©ros ou juste un simple Homme,vous pouvez choisir d'adapter votre fa√ßon de jouer √† la situation ou de d√©cidez comme nous que les Magisters sont des bon √† rien et qu'utiliser vos lames pour r√©gler les soucis est la meilleur option ! KOTOR , plus qu'une simple SAGA,les deux ont r√©ussi √† cr√©er un v√©ritable mythe autour du personnage de Revan.Un vrai plaisir de red√©couvrir le premi√®re OPUS qui part ses qualit√©s sc√©naristiques,de custom des personnages mais aussi de gameplay,propose une v√©ritable Aventure prenante !Le premier OPUS √† quelques d√©fauts,quelques bugs sur PC avec quelques crash parfois chiant mais un coup de clique droit lan√ßer en administrateur,le tour est jou√© c: !

Ce monsieur est un cancer √† lui tout seul, ce n‚Äôest pas pour rien qu‚Äôil a travaill√© chez Riot (League of Legends) √† l‚Äô√©poque mdr.Revenons √† ce jeu Last Man Standing. Amateur de jeux Bataille Royale, c‚Äôest tout naturellement que je me suis int√©ress√© √† ce jeu qui a l‚Äôavantage d‚Äô√™tre gratuit. Malheureusement de nombreux d√©fauts sont pr√©sents et, in fine, me donne amplement envie de ne pas recommander ce jeu. Avant toute chose √† l‚Äôheure o√π j‚Äô√©cris ces lignes ce jeu recueille pr√®s de 50¬†% d‚Äô√©valuations positifs r√©centes, c‚Äôest faible et me laisse √† croire que je ne suis pas le seul √† penser de la sorte. Ce n‚Äôest pas parce qu‚Äôun jeu est gratuit qu‚Äôon n‚Äôa pas le droit d‚Äôavoir des exigences en tant que joueur, en particulier quand celui-ci propose du contenu payant in-game.Pour commencer les graphismes sont immondes, le gameplay est lourd et la physique √©trange, je n‚Äôaccroche pas. Le jeu ne propose que 3 modes de jeu, il n‚Äôy a pas de v√©hicules, on ne choisit pas l‚Äôendroit d‚Äôapparition, on ne peut pas parler dans le chat textuel, beaucoup de tricheurs, toutefois l‚Äôinventaire propos√© est assez complet (bandages, pi√®ges, armes et accessoires). D‚Äôailleurs √† la sortie du jeu √† chaque fois que vous lanciez le jeu un √©norme spam apparaissait √† votre √©cran, vous proposant d‚Äô√©conomiser 50¬†% de r√©duction sur le pack de bienvenue vendu √† 19,99‚Ç?au lieu de 29,99‚Ç¨‚Ä?vous avez compris¬†? Et oui √ßa ne fait pas -50¬†% si vous avez au moins un niveau de classe √©l√©mentaire. Pour conclure je vous conseille de fuir ce jeu comme la peste, pour ma part je lui ai laiss√© sa chance en y jouant pr√®s de 20h. Choisissez plut√¥t un jeu comme PUBG ou Fortnite qui sont nettement mieux¬†! De plus le jeu est depuis fin Novembre 2017 laiss√© √† l‚Äôabandon, plus aucune mises √† jours et de communiqu√©s en provenance des d√©veloppeurs. Les joueurs se font de moins en moins pr√©sents.

Ce jeu j'y et jouer tout mon enfance, il est tout simplement incroyable, il resteras √† jamais mon jeu pr√©f√©r√© malheureusement le jeu commence √† mourir ... les anciens ont connu Nislt, et les fra√ßais ont connu le serv trade LVC (bien mal gr√®s toute les embrouilles) une belle nostalgie ce jeu ;)

Je revien sur ce que j'ai dit 5 ans apr√®s, ce jeux est une pur dinguerie, j'ai passer mon enfance √† jouer √† ce jeux, il est tout simplement parfait, simple mais efficace, le RP est cool (avec des gens asser mature et avec du monde comme √† l'√©poque) la survie en multiplayer est g√©niale, bon malheureusement le mondes manque maintenant, mais il √† √©norm√©ment progresser, et surtout le cr√©ateur et √† l'√©coutes des joueurs,et passionn√©es du jeu qu'il √† dev, hate de voir ce qu'il va donner son prochain jeu, ont se retrouve la bas, √† tout les ancien qui ont connu GaduGaming (les Gadu RP) la biz √† vous

La suite tant attendue d'un tr√®s grand jeu !Les diff√©rences avec Hotline Miami premier du nom sont l'histoire se d√©roulant soit avant, soit apr√®s le 1, cela d√©pend des missions, l'OST qui a √©t√© enrichie (elle est d'ailleurs mieux que le 1er), et les personnages. Le Steam Workshop √† √©galement √©t√© ajout√© au jeu, ce qui donne, contrairement au 1, une dur√©e de vie tr√®s longue :DJe vous recommande fortement ce jeu, mais pour comprendre un minimum l'histoire, je vous conseille de terminer √† fond le 1 (vous verrez que cela vous aidera √©norm√©ment).

Dans Postal 2 vous incarnez un personnage qui doit, chaque jour de la semaine, effectuer plusieurs sortes de t√¢ches (par exemple : acheter du lait, braquer une banque...) Ce jeu est tr√®s fun, vous pouvez vraiment faire tout ce que vous voulez, seul ou m√™me en coop. ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞)Les graphismes ne sont pas ouf mais vu la date de sortie du jeu cela s'explique. Le jeu est plut√¥t (beaucoup) violent (regardez quelques screenshots sur la page du jeu). En plus un workshop √† √©t√© ajout√©, ce qui rend les possibilit√©es quasi infinies. ^^ENfin bref, je vous recommande VRAIMENT ce jeu si vous adorez les opens worlds √† la Saints Row/GTA ou vous pouvez faire un peu tout ce que vous voulez, alors FONCEZ !
Tr√®s bon jeu de combat, tr√®s fun en multi et pas cher pour ce qu'il est !

Hotline Miami est un des meilleurs jeux auquels j'ai jou√©, et de loin !Son OST √† couper le souffle, ses graphismes old school g√©niaux, ses diff√©rents niveaux, son histoire tr√®s myst√©rieuse, de nombreux masques... Bref, vous vous amuserez tr√®s bien en repeignant les murs avec de la cervelle de mafieux Russes.Je vous recommande √©videmment tr√®s fortement ce jeu, si vous aimez l'action et le gore !

Project Zomboid est un tr√®s bon jeu de zombie. Il est tr√®s complet, l'immersion est tr√®s bonne, et contrairement √† ce que certains disent, je trouve les graphismes appropri√©s pour ce que peut nous offrir le gameplay (Comme Hotline Miami par exemple). Vous pouvez r√©gler le nombre de zombie dans votre partie solo/online et vous pouvez √©galement h√©berger une partie pour jouer avec vos amis en multi ! (Je trouve quand m√™me l'h√©bergement de parties assez complexe √† r√©aliser). Enfin bon, il reste un tr√®s bon jeu dans l'ensemble et son prix est correct pour ce qu'il √† a nous offrir. Je recommande fortement ce jeu.

Pl√ªtot bon jeu, beaux graphismes, un bon retour aux sources qui fait plaisir, et pour finir : l'un des modes zombies les plus terrifiants et r√©alistes de la saga. Petit point n√©gatif : le prix du jeu, mais vous pouvez toujours l'acheter moins cher en attendant des promos ou m√™me directement acheter la cl√© CD du jeu sur des sites faits pour.

Bon jeu, mais beaucoup trop cher √† l'heure qu'il est. Le mode histoire est en effet plut√¥t fun et vous allez s√ªrement y passer de nombreuses heures avec toutes les missions disponibles, celles qui sont cach√©es, et pour finir la libert√© mise √† votre disposition une fois le jeu termin√©.Mais maintenant, passons √† l'ENORME point faible de ce jeu qui est le mode online :-De plus en plus de cheaters, et Rockstar s'en bat un peu les couilles.-Au contraire, des joueurs n'ayant jamais cheat√© sur ce jeu voient leur argent retir√©, ou voir m√™me sont bannis pour aucune raison valable.-Syst√®me anti-cheat ECO+.-La communaut√© de gros pyjs de 10 ans.-Les prix des choses dans ce mode bordel... au m√™me temps c'est un peu la raison qui pousse les gens √† cheater.Voil√†, j'ai fait un bref r√©sum√© des gros points n√©gatifs de ce mode, et c'est d'ailleurs ce pour quoi je ne vous recommendrai pas ce jeu, sauf si vous voulez jouer tout seul dans votre coin en mode histoire ou en mode libre.

Une bonne grosse chiasse vid√©oludique payante √† la base et devenue gratuite, mais bien √©videmment aucun cadeau pour ceux qui ont pay√© le jeu, en plus d'√™tre une merde graphiquement (et pas que d'ailleurs). Bref : un bon gros foutage de gueule, niquez vous bien bande de gros fils de putes de d√©vloppeurs de morts

One of the greatest games ever made, and in my opinion the best game in the Prince of Persia game trilogy.It seamlessly unites everything that was great about sands of time and warrior within into a single, neat little package. The story - while it's quite simple, and it won't be throwing some crazy plot-twists your way, it keeps you motivated well enough to keep playing, on top of that the cast of characters is just overall great. Music - the soundtrack isn't as good as Warrior Within's, but it does its job well, its presence is felt, and it fits the narrative well. Gameplay - the combat is not as great as Warrior Within's BUT it makes up for it with the segments where you get to play as dark prince, other than that it brings a lot of new stuff to the table that wasn't present in the previous games, while at the same time keeping what works. Presentation - 10/10 this game is dripping with style while at the same time keeping the ever present Persian themes in-tact, the locations, characters and everything in-between just look so distinctive and cool it's been hard for me to find a game that's anything like it. Now, I highly recommend you play this BUT, the steam port of this game is the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?port of this game that I've played, and I've finished this game 3 times before, so I recommend getting your copy of the game from GOG. This one is just full of weird ass bugs that can ruin the immersion quite a bit. Anyway, here's to hoping that Ubisoft finally gets its head out of its ass, drops ass-asin creed and finally does something with this series again, cheers.
One of the games of all time

This game provides a (sometimes) very much needed escape from reality. To be honest I've spent several evenings on this bad boy and it's the most SOUL healing game I've ever played, it's absolutely spectacular how much can be achieved with such simple graphics. Besides being great at immersing you and making you forget how tough life can be for a while, it had also provided me with some valuable insights about my life and how I could improve it and myself. Not an understatement by the way, I really did find it that impactful. So it's a definitive recommendation from me (If you are into Banchous then this is a must buy btw)

Y'know, I won't deny that this game has some issues. But I want to mention some of the things that this game does really well  and what makes it worth buying, for example, the guns are extremely well done. All of them feel and sound and powerful. The  languages that can be selected are all voice acted and the voice acting is great. OH but the main appeal of this game is the unique way you can learn languages, it's studying made fun and interesting at it's best. EIther way, if any of this sounds good to you, then I'd say don't hesitate to buy this game, it's fun!

The game is a blast. The combat feels punchy and rewarding, the music is atmospheric and so are the sound effects you could say, all of it works together really well.Not gonna lie though, the game is pretty damn hard, but conquering it is worth it, especially after you realize what is the game's unique selling point which is the ability to take over the bodies of the enemies you face. Since each of them have different stats and weapons you will be actively considering which one suits your needs the best and actively strategizing whilst fighting hordes of enemies(though you can't go switching from one enemy to the other, you have a limited amount of power for that), on top of that there's also some environmental interaction too, you can use the traps set out for you in taking down your foes.All in all a fascinating game and I highly recommend you check it out if you are into rouge/soul-likes.

Want to recommend the game but don't want to write a script so I'll list some pro's and consPros: ‚Ä?Music is GREAT‚Ä?Weapons feel great and there's use for each of them, you'll be actively cycling through all of them, and even occasionally using the pistol and your melee weapon‚Ä?Atmosphere is amazing‚Ä?Enemy designs are fantastic‚Ä?It's hard as a shooter with a retro feel should be like ‚Ä?You can interact with your environment quite a lot and there's plenty of secrets to be found Cons: ‚Ä?I know it's kinda silly to ask for a story in a shooter game but it would be great if the player would have the ability to find out more about the world and how it went to ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• by reading signposts, notes or w/e that can be seen and read throughout the game world. It's kinda there but it should be expanded upon‚Ä?There are no other cons, the game is great and you should go buy it... NOW!

I'm not one for survival games but this was great. It's easy to get into and a load of fun, I usually avoid games of this type since it always feels like it takes quite a long time to get familiar with all the mechanics and the workings of the game but with Terminus I had no trouble jumping in and having fun. Also, while the game is early access there's already quite a lot of content available, and while playing I didn't encounter any bugs, which is rather rare for early access games. Not much else to say here, if you are a fan of survival games like this then you won't regret this purchase.

Nice little platformer, easy to pick up and play at any time, though, as some of the reviewers said before me, it's pretty darn difficult. Either way, the basic premise goes like this, you get one of the three abilities which are assigned to you depending on your mood, then you get thrown into the game world and you go through a platforming section designed around the ability you get. It's fun and rewarding but there are some things that I wish would be added to the game, first and foremost it needs more levels, at the moment I think it would take me about an hour max to go through the game, so more content needs to be added. Other than that there are a couple of bugs, like the player being able to skip a portion of the level with the double jump ability or being able to jump into a different level that is based on the dash ability. All in all, while there are flaws here and there I still think it's worth your time and money. üëç

Fun game. It was actually a lot easier to get into it than expected. A couple of things that I could mention which makes this game stand out is the amount of detail that is present in the devices and the products that you produce, if you zoom in you can actually see the products getting painted/assembled, and you can also hear the sounds of robots and the devices operating, it's pretty cool. Other than that this game offers plenty of content to entertain the player on days on end. If you find these sort of games interesting then this is a must buy.

A really fun platformer that clearly pays homage to some of the all-time classics like Mario 64 and Sonic Adventures. There are plenty of levels and worlds to see, the level design is great. The movement, while it can feel a bit slow at times, gives the player a lot of maneuver options, partially because you will be actively switching from one of the characters you control to the other. (To give a better idea of how this works to new players I'd compare it to switching between sonic and tails on the fly, sounds cool, doesn't it) I'd say give definitely give this game a try if you are looking for some solid platformers to play.

From someone who has over 500 hours in this game, I can tell you that this game is not worth $1, not anymore atleast.It used to be fun in alpha, before they started tweaking everything, and giving streamers special treatment, and hiring people who bashed the game constantly.There's bugs everywhere, there's always been bugs, and there will always be bugs because the developers are either clueless or were only trying to make a quick buck. Also, they didn't take one small thing from all the other MMO's.. A Public Testing Server.. As obvious as it might seem, that's something these money hungry developer's either didn't consider or just plain over looked due to costs / labor.There's been a cheating problem since the beginning and there will always be a cheater problem because instead of investing in an actual anti-cheat (Their current one is FairFight and it records statistics, all in-game bans are done by hand.) I seriously recommend you not play this unless you plan on cheating yourself because that is the only way you'll ever survive, unless you're actually somewhat decent at FPS's, which,  in that case, be prepared to be banned at random times because a streamer or someone well known in the community said you cheated.In the beginning, the developers stole their terms of service from League of Legends, banned people at random times to scare off cheaters (their version of an anti-cheat), and used fake screenshots which resulted in the game originally being pulled from steam. (Seriously.) It's for some reason been allowed back onto steam, and I believe everyone should know of this games terrible past and know that it's not changed one bit. Sergey Titov "OP Productions, LLC. CEO" (Previously known as Hammerpoint Productions) even went as far as to lie in interviews about this game, and delete any comments or reviews that said otherwise. Players who requested a refund originally were reported and blacklisted from the website which then caused them to have international troubles making any further purchases for anything, even things not involved with online games, I.E. General online shopping..Taken directly from a mod who previously worked for Hammerpoint / OP Productionshttp://leviathyn.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/t6F9c.jpg (Source - http://www.leviathyn.com/news/2012/11/29/the-warz-team-blacklists-customers-asking-for-refunds-and-gets-blasted-by-ex-mod/ )Avoid this game at all costs.

I loved it. You'll want to play and replay it many times. Outstanding music, a sad story told in a melancholic and poetic way, a pleasant gameplay, with many weapons and combos to experiment with. If you find it easy, there are many ways to make it harder. Also some nice easter eggs/secrets. The OST has become a core part of my music library.Play it, you won't repent!

The game is amazing. The art is simply breathtaking, same goes for music and animations.The story is nice, fairy, moving.Controlling Ori is satisfying, the controls are fluid, the animations are very well done. A very high level, undoubtedly. The gameplay is a very classical platform, all jumps, enemies, fire-spitting plants, wall jumps, several abilities unlocked through the game, some of which are original and add a lot to the gameplay.The only downside, sometimes the gameplay is a bit frustrating. Too many jumps are tight to the limit, which is good sometimes, but other times it's just pointless. The first time you play, you'll die from 600 to 1000+ times, really sometimes you repeat the same part over and over even 10-20 times. At the beginning i found this very frustrating, with time i learnt to manage checkpoints more wisely (which is, spamming them).To summarize: this game is simply AMAZING, but expect to get mad and swear even more than in DOTA 2.

I feel like I have enough game time to give a fair review now.First off, good game. It still has some issues in stability and mechanics, but in terms of gameplay and possibilities, it sure presents a lot of fun and opportunities. But all reviews got to contain some critique for them to be useful. So here we go.The fact that the outside atmosphere has any effect on you while you're wearing a spacesuit with its oxygen supply is very confusing. I am of course referring to pneumonia you get in caves due to air humidity. I feel like this doesn't make much sense since you are in an enclosed suit with no access to outside air and stuff. I have gotten the idea that the air is toxic and therefore other animals can live there unharmed, and you don't instantly choke when you run out of oxygen. But because some of the animals living there are completely normal animals it makes this mechanic feel like a cheap excuse to make it "space-related". I won't complain too much about this, but making all the animal's something unique would make it more believable. Either just mutated versions or completely new species. This is a PVE game, but it feels much more like EVP. When you enter the snowy mountains in the ice expedition chapter, the blizzard starts upon first entry, and not just randomly. It stopped the moment I left and started the moment I went back in. It feels more like some parts of the environment are programmed to destroy you or to make your life difficult. And it doesn't feel authentic. A harsh environment is one thing, but I feel it can be RNG-based and not programmed specifically to location and objective. The very first mission just spawned bears or wolves out of the blue on top of the scanner to make it more difficult. And that is not PVE I feel like. That's EVP, which is not what was promised. Ruins the immersion a bit. I also don't like the way stamina, debuffs, and some of that stuff work and react with each other, as much of it don't make any sense, but I understand that it's a game and that it is to make the game more challenging, but I also feel that it can be done in a better and more immersive way. Conclusion: It's a game with many possibilities and the gameplay drags you out of reality and suddenly you've spent 8 hours in-game without realizing it. So the game is not bad per se, but it got a lot of things that can be improved to make it even better. I recommend it purely because the game is rich in content and possibilities.

This game is my favorite Sandbox game of them all.It's very complicated, but that is one of the biggest reason I like it. It's not for Casual players at all.It's like if you combine rocket science with Minecraft.You can build anything from Satellites that obliterate other ships with Lasers or build U-Boats with torpedoes that kill your targets while being completly silent.You can build so many different things, there is almost no limit to it.The Campaign(s) is/are really solid and the sandbox is great.You have different planets that you can build your stuff on. You can even build buildings and tanks.TL;DR Very complicated, much creativity needed.

This game is one of my Favorites. I would go out and say, this is the best "Sandbox Simulation" Game out there. Because, if you love space, you can do whatever SpaceX or Nasa is doing right now! You can even go further than our own earth (or kerbin). There is a whole load of planets that you can travel to and land on. It's not like pointing yourself in a direction and accelerating, because actual physics are involved in all you do. So you have to make an orbit around Kerbin and expand it until it reaches the same height as the planet you want to land on. You also have to make satellites that relay information from earth to you or the other way around. There is so much to do in the base game, and even more stuff to do when you install mods, which have a really easy way to install them and have great intigration in to the game.I just love this game. It's for the people who like space and who want to learn more on how actual space flight works and what you need for your rocket to fly how it's supposed to do.

Cities: Skylines is a game that you want to play if you don't feel like playing action games or "Tryhard" games. It's soothing but at the same time, it does not get too boring. It's the best game for its type of game. You have complicated Traffic system, a good amount of City management and offers a gigantic customization opportunity. Almost everything is perfect in this game. Only almost, because if you don't have that good of a PC then this game will struggle, especially because it is very CPU heavy. If you mod it too hard it will most likely crash and the stability in the Vanilla game isn't too great either.  Other than that, it is one of my favorite games to relax, 9 / 10

Life is Strange is one of those rare "great games". The only real problem I have with this game, that it is not actually a game, but an amazing interactive movie. You have the ability to reverse time, which greatly improves the "choicemaking" aspect of the game. Because if you think you f**ked a choice up and you wanna redo it and choose something different, you can and you won't get punished for it.The game gives you moral choices that you can't answer "correctly" because, for example, you don't want to kill someone you really like but if you do, you save 10 people you don't know/like at all, you really get carried away from all of the awesome characters in this game. It's totally normal to choose to kill 10 people because you like that one character so much. The characters are really "deep" and gives you a sense of their life, you can really feel with the characters and what they have gone through. It is, no doubt, an emotional adventure.

Zoo... This is where the fun begins!A fun simulation game of being a Zoo keeper, or manager of one rather.I've played lots of simulation games previously, to name a few: The Sims (2, 3, 4), Spore, Cities Skylines, SimCity.This one definitely is a new experience for me, as I've not managed a zoo before, sure they have them in CS (Cities Skylines) but not with this level of details, where you have other (more talented then me) people whom create things so well and detailed, I can just focus on maintaining the habitats and animals and staff and such, whilst others do the designing and building, and I just need to add some features for the animals to be happy like heat, cooling and such. I love this game to bits, and since buying it recently not been able to stop playing it.Now I got it on sale, so I definitely feel the money was worth spending on this and some DLC that I found amusing and promising. I guess it depends on the buyer, if you enjoy these types of managing and buidling and maintaining simulator, definitely get it, especially if you are an animal lover of all creatures, or even some, just make a zoo with your favourite animals in them, it's all up to you!Conclusion:An amazing and wonderfully made game, sure it has it flaws with bugs and even some CTD for my part at times, but since adjusting some settings and what not, it's not happened since.There is community events for you to take part in, and earn some credits to purchase special animals, this definitely kept me intressted to play it and get myself a lion habit and have lions in them, as you can only get them with this special currency.Price wise I'd say it's worth it, especially at a sale, but if you're somewhat like me that love these kinds of managment simulators, this should be a no-brainer! Rating: 8/10

Now of course this game has it's bugs, as any game does. One may feel it should of remained in the Early Access because of the bugs and since it still says on some blueprints and missions etc.: "Soon coming". But just because it's considered a full release don't mean it's development is over, far from it. Look at No Man's Sky and Minecraft. Constantly getting new updates and features, for FREE. NMS is one of the games with the worst launches ever, and see how far they've come now. Now of course each developer is different, but don't be so fast to assume and judge when it's just been released to a full release. However, I love this game and it's mechanics. The felling of trees is so satisfying and the fact you can carve out a rock and make it hollow and make a campfire within to shelter it from rain. If you chop down a tree and it hits something you've built, it'll take damage, and may even break the structure. The fire will spread if the circumstances are there for it to occur. I have my graphics set to Mid/high and definitely think it looks great, now obviously this is my opinion, and so of course may not be yours. I've got a RTX 2070 Super, i9 9900k 5Ghz, 32 GB ram 3200mhz, and with the settings I got I get around 60-80 FPS dependent on the scenario. But if there is a big forest fire going on, they drop down to 20-40 depending on how close I am, and of course the amount of fire going on. As for me the only con I have so far;The game does feel a bit narrow as you're in a valley of mountains surrounded on either side in the forest biome (not sure how it is outside this biome as I haven't gotten there yet.) But especially so far it feels narrow as you only have a set of way to travel, it don't take long to go to one side of the mountain side to the other. If they had expanded it further so it don't feel so narrow, I'd feel much more immersed and epsecially if they made it like other open world games, look at BotW for instance, huge world and many ways to travel around. Where as here it's just one set of a path you can take, either forward or backwards, as the sides are blocked off with a huge mountain.However I do really enjoy this game and it's mechanics, building houses is easy and fun, you can place the pillar for support of the house where ever you want, it's not limited to a set place, once you place the first one, you can then use that to get a grid and place them accordingly to fit the grid of where that pillar is. Overall I give this game a 7/10. Visiually gorgeous and stunning. The survival elements and mechanics is just where this game really shines from other survival genres in my opinion.

Sconsiglio vivamente l'acquisto di questo gioco al prezzo attuale di 20,99‚Ç?Questo gioco come idea base ha un Mount&Blade impostato sul periodo moderno con armi automatiche, RPG, Artiglieria - Elicotteri - Droni (aggiunti con la pi√π recente versione)*Lo consiglierei?Come concetto √® gioco la base c'√®, ma a 20,99‚Ç?no, magari durante uno dei grandi saldi di steam, giusto per passarci su qualche ora, altrimenti no*Perch√® lo sconsiglio:Allo stato attuale dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento il gioco presenta bug che potrebbero rovinarti una partita come il bloccarsi all'interno di un albero, mentre le aggiunte recenti come l'artiglieria √® eccessivamente op mentre l'elicottero, nonostante spari ai nemici, li manca completamente rendendola inutile;Le partite possono essere divertenti all'inizio ma dopo un po sono sempre ripetitive.*Il gioco √® morto:Nonostante l'ultime annuncio ufficiale lasciatoci dai programmatori, che alla recensione attuale sono passati un anno e qualche mese con la promessa di un overhaul completo del gioco, nel loro discord i programmatori scomparsi per un lungo periodo abbandonando la community e nascondendo diversi canali lasciando allo stato attuale solo 2/3 canali, i loro ultimi messaggi parlavano del loro continuo lavoro sul questo fantomatico "overhaul" ma senza rilasciare niente riguardo progressi e stato mentre emergono sempre pi√π informazioni riguardo il loro lavoro nell'ultimo periodo ad altri giochi sotto nomi di "ditte" diverse e venduti sempre qui su steam.Consiglio di guardare tra le discussioni di questo gioco poich√® uno degli ex moderatori ha lasciato attaccato un ultimo suo messaggio riguardo alla situazione all'interno e suggerisce un'altro progetto di un altro promettente programmatore con simili idee di questo gioco ed √® molto attivo nel discord rilasciando periodici notizie riguardo al suo progresso.Grazie per aver letto la mia lunga recensione :)P.s. Aggiorner√≤ la recensione in caso di futuri aggiornamenti :)

Game is down right amazing! It has so much potential. I see a lot of Freelancer influence too. The ship combat reminds me of Gimbal. The customization is pretty good. I don't like the lack of camera rotation or see through walls for desiging ships however. The devs are very responsive to feedback.  While limited I find the story to be very good so far.Below I will do a list of pros, neautral and cons.Pros:Potential is high. Very high. This game is indie game of the year level potential.The story is great albeit very limited. A few spots you can tell it's very work in progress but it is a very basic implementation.The flight mechanics are great. The use of travel "lanes" and warp gates reminds me of freelancer. I love it.The combat is great! I wish there as more weapons and bigger ships but overall it's great so far.The environment is wonderful and gorgeous! I love the ice field. Again it reminds me of Freelancer.Neutral:The graphics are decent. Not triple a and not minecraft voxel ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô? Overall they work though.The game when I last played had some serious bugs. It is early access so it's expected but these were game breaking where I had to reload saves. I will remove this as the game progresses if I see the bugs fixed or move it to negative if it laucnhes with them in tact.Bad:The ship design has some flaws. It's hard to see through walls for placing stuff and I don't like the very limited ship layouts. it makes for only a few designs being good for gunboats/heavy fighter builds. The rest being good for cargo... maybe?Overall it's a great game so far that I highly recommend with the caveat that it's clearly in an alpha state.
Game is dead and abondoned. Avoid like the plauge. As that is what it is. Another case of dev early access abandonment for making other games or just getting bored and giving 0 communication.

Game has a spyware app called Red Shell included. When I contacted WB support to ask about it's removal. They out right refused to answer the question. I can't in good conscious recommend this game to anyone. I will gladly provide copies of the emails upon request.

The game does not function properly with a mouse and keyboard and has NO keybinding support of any kind. Which is a must in modern pc gaming. according to the person with a dev tag that is not a dev, the actual dev considered it during early development but decided not to implement it. (wtf?) So if you intend to play with a mouse/keyboard, stay away until this is fixed.

I want to start this review by saying I was given a free copy by the wonderful dev team in exchange for testing and providing some advertising to some communities I am a part of.TLDR version at the end.I really like this game. I do however see some minor issues and some things that I just feel are outright missing. I do reccommend this game however as it is very playable and fun in the current form which is rare for early access.Pros:Mechs, gundam style.Graphics are amazing. Best unity engine graphics I have ever seen.Executions.Mostly customizable units. You can customize every part. Including the sword and shield. I just wish you could change the guns out. Sadly they are tied to the respective part (arms for small/missles, chest for heavy). However it still has some very deep customization. You can even change the color/flair of the unit.Missions are fun yet not too hard. I have only played on normal but the missions were easy yet tough enough to make me think.Survivial mode. I love this mode. I just wish the rewards were given every time instead of for hitting x wave. However it's so fun trying to beat the highest score.Cons:Repetitive. The game can get pretty repetitive and there seems minimal diffrence besides stats between the 3 unit types. I wish there was more cosmetic differences.  However this has not kept me from enjoying this game for hours.Lack of co-op is sad. I would love to do the survival mode with a friend on this. It would be so fun competing to see who could get more kills etc.TLDR: Game is very fun especially for an early access game. Could use some more options and game modes and co-op but in general is a great game. I highly recommend it.

It's decent - not mind-blowing. 9/10 for atmosphere. Lots of the characters are recycled and it has some fun bits and cool design. The outpost capturing feels a bit more like FC3 and has some really cool scavange/recapture mechanics. The world feels a bit big and empty.Sadly you can no longer modify guns, everything is a prefab, which is a bit sad. Overall worth buying if on a decent sale. havent tested coop but coops FC5 was good

This has to give Skyrim a run for its money in the competition for most overrated game of all time.Similar to Skyrim actually in the enemy variety department, every enemy is either some draugr humanoid or a troll.Trash combat, no jump button, tacked on skinner box RPG system, tacked on Ubisoft style open world. I've played for 5 hours and I feel like the game is still holding my hand and forcing me into boring walking simulator sections. The graphics are good and the port is great, I'll give it that at least.Please give us God of War 1-3 remastered on Steam so we can play some actually good games.

The most overrated game of all time.Brain dead combat, boring characters and stories with no meaningful choices, every dungeon is the same cave copy pasted with the same draugr enemy types. At least Oblivion had some interesting quests like the Dark Brotherhood questline.I guess people just love this game because of the modding community.
Looking forward to playing these games but it instantly gets a negative review due to the fact that it requires Origin.No one wants an Origin account.

Not sure what the infinite refers to:-the amount of time the game crashes-the amount of money you need to collect all the cosmetics-the amount of times you have to press a switch in campaign and trigger a cutscene where the new Cortana activates something and a brute chieftain yells at you via hologram
Leaving negative reviews on all my DLC because the game continues to be a broken mess and they refuse to fix anything.

Pros:-It's an RPG where you play as a shark. What more do I need to say?-Narrator is funny sometimes.-The last boss is super spooky and actually somewhat challenging.-Decent visuals.Cons:-Still optimised like trash and you get lots of frame drops and occasional crashes (running an RTX 3070).-Doubles down on the bad controls from the base game and many quests in the DLC focus on those bad controls. It would honestly be more fun if it was just mindless button mashing like the base game.-Took me roughly 5 hours to 100%. Obviously lacks content.I want to support this game because I love the idea of a Shark RPG but this game and the DLC are just not worth the money. You need to give us literally 3 times the content to make it worth the price. They already re-used the main games environments in the DLC to pad out the content so why not at least pad it out some more? I understand assets require money and time to make but I expect more value for my money and I don't believe that's being entitled. 15 hours of gameplay is quite stingy for $70 AUD.

Initially I was sceptical of this game because it forces you into a melee playstyle and I loved doing magic and bow builds in Dark Souls. Well I'm glad that the game is focused on melee because it has the best third-person melee system of any game ever. It also has a variety of challenging bosses and mini-bosses and the greatest last boss of a video game ever. The last boss in this game will test you on everything you have learned throughout the game and push you to your limits in terms of skill.From Software continue to make great games. I can't wait for Elden Ring.

This is like a much easier version of Sekiro (played on max difficulty Jedi Grandmaster). The combat is a bit janky and the game has a lot of bugs. The story doesn't bore you to death.Overall, the best game EA has published in 10 years.

I'd like to recommend this 10 year old game to my friends but it never goes on sale. Pretty greedy of From Software to remove the Prepare to Die edition from the store and replace it with this version which is BARELY remastered at all. There are mods for the Prepare to Die edition which remaster the game better. I love the original Dark Souls but this remaster is just a pure cash grab to capitalise off the game's hype. I mean they didn't even fix multiple game breaking bugs for crying out loud!

-Cons: Too short, not as challenging as TAG1, soundtrack is not very memorable and the final boss is badly designed. -Pros: Art direction is great as always, new weapon is fun to use.That being said... I'm still leaving a positive review because ID did such a great job with the base game. Hope you guys will create another Doom game in the future, maybe we can get a re-imagined version of Quake?

This game is excellent. It has enjoyable game play and top notch humour. At times it can get infuriating, especially the section where you fight a submarine. But its well worth playing through to the end, especially for the ending.

Although it drags a bit near the end. This is without a doubt one of the best games I've ever played. No other game to date allows the freedom I've experienced in this game. And its story is amazing as well. Prey 2017 is a masterpiece.

When you look out on coast at a beach. You feel the wind rustling in your air, the sound of waves crashing on the sand. You see the deep blue of the sea and smell the salt in the air. That feeling right there, the feeling of being in the moment, is the feeling that this game elicits. The world around you lives and breathes and the walls of every building are caked in character. The people have hopes and fears and dreams. And it all feels so real. It is the most beautiful game I have ever played. I wish I forgot about it so I could experience it for the first time all over again. This is the kind of game that everyone needs to play at least once in their lives. That feeling of simply existing has never really been given to me by any other game as strongly as this one. Buy it now.

I do really like this game and have spent alot of time playing it. But me and my friend built a pretty descent base and spent 60 hours building it. Then our town internet cut out for two days. When we came back, our 60 hours worth of farming and building was gone because of this new decay system, only tc remained and our metal floors. Before it was good because it was essential for you to come on but not farm for two hours in order to maintain your base. Maybe 6 months ago the game was really fun to play and once you got the resources you could build anything you want. Then they added components which were really interesting and fun to use. It made it harder to craft things like aks which was a good change. Then they added xp system which was pretty bad in my opinion. Then they added blueprints with components. Blueprints were removed before which almost everyone cheered for. Then they decided to add it back with the components system. So now it takes a whole wipe to get a c4 and then you can't use it because everyones got 3 layer honecombed bases. It is literaly just a guessing game in order to get the part that you want unless you steal it off someone else with the melee weapons you find in component chests (which is very possible because people are vegies and dont know how to aim). In my opinion if they remove the 100x speed decay (what it feels like) or slow it down and they remove or dial down the blueprint system I could easily give this game 10/10. It is a great game with active players and devs but I am just sick of this update at the moment.Although I sometimes find this game very frustrating you sometimes have those wipes where everything goes your way and you find this game being the best you have ever played. This game does need to be changed in my opinion but it is still a very good game worth buying.

I have to extremely recommend this game. I have only played the main story and the heart of stone dlc and I am only 100 hours in. I just love the freedom in which you can explore the map and treverse the landscape, giving me options to go on side quests just around the world made me really happy. Although the main story felt a bit padded out and more of fetch quests than what it should have been and most of the story was told through cutscenes which were really good but sometimes would have been better if something else happened or was told while I was doing something (my opinion) but it was made up with the awesome story and fighting mechanics. I still have to complete blood and wine, and once I am done that I am for sure going to restart my game to get a new (hopefully good) ending and change many of the dialogue options you have to change the experience completely.
Good game, enjoyed it to its max, but better with friends.

Game randomly crashes at least once every few hours, sometimes in back-to-back openings/play attempts. D/C's from servers, or doesn't connect at all almost constantly. Can take an hour to even start playing due to launch crashes, and once open can immediately crash upon: person joining, D/C'ing from server, you joining, or simply randomly before you can do anything. Playing sometimes looks like a behind the scenes stop-motion movie pre-production. Got an anti-cheat warning that forced me to restart game after it crashed twice, and during that first opening (pre-crash) had to redo part of a quest because it D/C'd from the server on a single-player campaign game . . . If this doesn't change soon, I'm putting in for a refund.

Noticeably worse the League of Legends, which is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to begin with, with the one caveat being that their are less kids and the immature here, so less spam/toxic nonsense. However, there is far more trash.

One of the greatest open-world RPGs, and RPGs in general, of all time. One of the first and greatest sources of mass moding, and changed the way games came after. 10 years later it's still better than some new games, and the modding community has updated it to the point that it could still compete with AAA games if it were released for the first time as such.

Basic mechanics of the game will cause it to crash, having equal numbers in a defensive position is still somehow even. Auto-Resolving is better than fighting sometimes (for results), surrounding an enemy with 2+ separate groups/stacks can still result in 1v1 fights, units that are meant to counter other units don't, diplomacy is a mess, not meta-gaming is costly. Legendary mode can be easier than normal for everything but diplomacy. Horribly made, thought out, and executed game.
About as close as one can get to a Mass Effect, SW: KotoR, DragonAge game these days outside of the Witcher. Very Enjoyable.

Maps have no orientation, and do not correspond to characters 100%, overwatch/ambush/etc., does not work as intended (try setting up 5 gangers, and watch enemies walk right past you, literally, around 3/10 of the time, you cannot guarantee you positioning due to the game resetting characters if it feels that you are "unsafe" instead of having built in penalties, mechanics, movement, or simply letting it be for taking risks. Objectives will be vaguely described, but half the markers are missing, tell you nothing, lack a legend, and requires playthrough to memorize it instead. Ranged weapons, and even melee weapons, jam at a rate of 1/3 atks per weapon on average, higher if using abilities. The pacing, programming and vision honestly, is incredibly slow, speed and otherwise,  having to watch the same screens tell you who's turn it is, what character, even if only one character can act/is left, having to thumb/scroll through all available options for everything in the game, even if half the options are unavailable, and watching the AI take 30s to make initial decisions, then 15-20s every time they get hit, only to finish their initial action, then stand there for 10-15s. One of the most lazily programmed and designed game I have ever experienced. Oh, and if a match takes an hour, but you are defeated due to all of the above? You start from the beginning.

What a great little puzzle-game!Somehow I found the way to this game, a few days before its release. I liked the concept and the pixel-art, so I decided to put it on my wishlist.I was happy when I received an e-mail a few days after that this game is available now. One day after I made the purchase, and I started playing the game on the same day.The game was right how I imagined it to be. A puzzle-platformer mixed with mystery. If I had to compare it to another game, I would name the "Portal"-series.I managed to get 7 out of 9 achievements. Some were easy, some were hard to achieve. There are 2 achievements left, and I am not quiet sure how to get them. But I will for sure!I can suggest this game to everyone who loves puzzles with a small amount of mystery-elements like "Portal" and "The Talos Principle".Thanks for reading, and have fun discovering all the achievements and mysteries! :)

Please follow my Curator Page: Challenging GamesReview: 'Hold 10 Seconds'Full Rating and Summary at the Bottom'Hold 10 Seconds'; the first release from indie-game developer Blindsoft, is a deceptively difficult and somewhat reaction-based 2D-platformer that provides a unique and greater challenge than you'd think at first glance. GameplayThe gameplay is simple. You have three major movement options, the jump, the grab and later on, the dash. You have to use each of these tools to get across and on to platforms to avoid falling off the screen, trying to survive for 10 seconds. The platforming is mostly reaction-based, you see your next location and you figure out how you're going to get there, feeling like something akin to 'Super Meat Boy'.This simple, yet fairly effective loop provides an adrenaline-pumping or angering and mostly fun challenge.Throughout the game, new concepts and challenges are added to keep it fresh. Things like moving platforms, spinning platforms, gravity changes and even some weird 3D rotating platforms.From what I've seen, the bosses are mostly just regular gameplay, with a lot more intensity thanks to its harder difficulty, a test of the new mechanics you've learned, and the music.A problem, albeit a somewhat small one, that I have with the movement, is that it can feel out of control from the player sometimes. This is sometimes due to the sort of 'slidey' feel that your character has, although this can be seen as a design decision. Despite this, the controls feel tight most of the time.Another problem I have is that, when you die, the game opens the pause screen, rather than just placing you back into the level. This can really slow down the pace of the game, making it feel like a drag trying to get through levels you are finding difficult.**Respawn times have been optimized and made automatic. This makes the game feel a lot better than before. Thank you devs.DesignThe design is themed around a retro aesthetic, with it's CRT monitor border and scan lines and film grain. A problem I have with the design. There is not a lot of variation present, making it look the same for a lot of the time you play this game. Even just a few color changes would add a lot.Fairness/ChallengeThe game is mostly fair in its difficulty. It does not introduce concepts suddenly, or abruptly, and gives you time to understand how it works.The difficulty curve is usually fair and lets you get through a few levels to get used to the new concept with the difficulty ramping up each time.ConclusionPros+ Challenging yet fair+ Good controls+ FunCons- Not much variation in design between each set of levels- Pause between death screens slows down the pace of the game.- Alt-tabbing game can freeze it.Overall, 'Hold 10 Seconds' is a game that provides a deceptively difficult experience that is pretty fun to play and is definitely challenging. Although it does suffer from a few hiccups, and lack of design variation, it is still a good experience. And at only $3 USD, it's worth its price. Factor Rating Gameplay 8 Design 6 Fairness/Challenge 7.5 Story N/A Pure Difficulty 7.5Overall Rating: 7.2/10(Excluding difficulty)------------------------------------------------------Rating ExplanationGameplay: how good it feels, and how well each tool is used.Story: the quality of the story and it's messagesDesign: style of the game - not directly graphics, and how well the design is done.Sound/Music: how well the sound and music fits in, and the quality of them.Fairness/Challenge: how fair the game is in terms of difficulty; not artificial difficulty.Pure Difficulty: simply how difficult the game is.Overall: average of all factors.------------------------------------------------------This game was reviewed with a key/code provided by the developer for free. Review and opinion is not impacted or changed by this.

I've seen a few reviews on this and here's my opinion, yes I know it's definitely late, but if you are a recent purchaser, this can be useful.If you have the money, and like this game enough, then buy the Season Pass (both the DLCs).Yes, Ashes of Ariandel isn't close to as good as the Ringed City, but this does not mean that it is not worth your time or money, especially on discount. It has a pretty great environment and a ridiculous, yet awesome three-phase boss fight. Also, if you care enough, then Ashes of Ariandel is somewhat of a setup for Ringed City.If you are only wanting to buy one and not another, Buy The Ringed City.Here are some pros and cons of each DLC to be aware of.Ashes of AriandelPROS+ Pretty great environment+ Awesome and intense three-phase main boss fight+ MusicCONS- Pretty bad optional boss (First phase is a PvP enemy boss) (great music though)- Pretty Short (~3-5 hours)- Occasional gank fest (lots of corners and turns)OVERALL, Ashes of Ariandel is a good DLC that is worth playing, if you are willing to buy it. It is more oriented towards combat situations, rather than furthering the lore of Dark Souls 3.7.5/10The Ringed CityPROS+ Probably the best Duo Boss fight since Ornstein and Smough+ Amazing final boss fight that feels worthy of the final boss of the Dark Souls Franchise.+ Pretty great environments+ Good length (~7-8 hours)+ Music+ Two major new areasPLAYER-DEPENDENT= Two bosses have ridiculous health poolsCONS- Gank fest at times- Another PvP Boss (actual PvP if online enabled)OVERALL, Ringed City is a great DLC that is absolutely worth playing, and has an incredible, yet satisfying difficulty with great bosses and environments, and does feel like a true conclusion to the Dark Souls franchise.9/10
