If you enjoyed Hotline Miami 1 or didn't get around to playing Hotline Miami, you should absolutely read this. Either that... or run over to a friends house and play through a few floors because this game truly speaks for itself. ( Usually through horrifying flash backs, complete with blood baths or surrealistic-nightmare dreams or visions from people that may be gifted... or are just completely insane. But hey! At least they're complete sentences! ){ How do I know if I will like the game?! }:-If you're a fan of Kill Bill, Berserk, Pulp fiction, Django Unchained, Drive, or realistic violence in general, then you will absolutely fall in love this game. -Top down twin-stick shooter fans, this is your freaking moment! The variety of Gameplay Based on Character and mask, The  Puzzle Solving mix in with twitchy split second decisions could not be done any better then it is right here! And if your afraid of death because some friend told you or showed you that everyone is a 'one-hit-kill', why? When you die it takes less then ¬º of a second to start the level over again, meaning that while you are able to fail, It won't be for long before you turn into that amazing bad ass in the movies, a tornado of death and destruction causing a complete massacre from room to room on a floor full of 20 people or more.-If you like the Techno, Electronic Dance Music, or club music of the present day OR 80's AND you have been looking for a couple new tracks, ones that perhaps just feel a bit more... updated. Then look no further! This is your sound track. The one you will be jamming out to for the next YEAR. With 49 tracks from varying artists, it nicely translates over to around 3 hours and 18 minutes of insanely epic music to murder by. (My current personal favorite would have to be 'In the Face of Evil by Magic Sword' which I have been listening to on loop while writing this review and yes! I have an adrenaline rush going right now too!)-Do you like Indie Games and love supporting people that make content which may not appeal to everyone?.... Then why are you wasting your time reading this?{ When SHOULDN'T I get Hotline Miami?! }:-Oh dear, you're squeamish you say? Please pick up your belongings and exit stage left. This game, despite its somewhat SNES looking style, is not for the faint of heart. Necks will be slit, heads bashed in with, like, the brain just... dripping out, and stomachs will be blown open! With shotguns! -You aren't and have never been a fan of Twitchy fast paced games. While I may have said before that you can try a level over and over and over again as if nothing every happened, there is this slight bit of randomness to it. Not everything is always exact which adds that slight split second decision making which you will eventually have to have, to some extent.-You hate any sort of electronic music. This is a big one because it's constantly droning on in the background so... yeah. You may want to watch some gameplay first before you make your decision. However, you can always just configure the game so the music doesn't play... eh?-You hate stories in games that seem to be all over the place with tons of characters all doing different things to either reach a goal or just survive.-You aren't a fan of 'the Surreal' and find nightmares or/and visions of the future to be just a bit clich√©. -Last but definitely not least, you just have no heart and soul, and for some reason you want to be the hipster of the hipsters and so, you don't want to play Hotline Miami 1 or 2 because you are deterred by how passionate the fans of the people are who play this game. You soulless sack... of waste...go die.Sorry about that last part but in all honesty, that was me not being biased or at least as minimal as possible. This game really IS one that I personally think that EVERYONE should try out at least once in there life time. (And in all honesty, one that most people should own too.) So, for Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number... for the first time ever: ***** PERFECT ‚Ä?10/10 *****And... I think this may be the only game on steam that I will EVER give this rating to. Don't get me wrong, there are a TON of really great games out there that are totally worth playing but... this game somehow transcends above and beyond the sum of it's parts. It is far better then such a simple, basic concept, has any right to be.That's all for now! Cheers!

Savant is a simple game that runs an average playtime of about 45 minutes. And, I suppose that is what‚Äôs to be expected for a 2 dollar indie title. Though, here is the thing.Savant for me, was an amazing purchase. If you are someone that 'needs' a good story with their indie game, you might want to look elsewhere. This is a game that is all about style. With its odd look of Cyber Punk-Fantasy and loud Dubstep blaring in the back ground to get your adrenaline running. Savant is more akin to games such as Realm of the Mad God or even Hotline Miami. With its tight controls and literally taking no time to lean. It‚Äôs an 'aim with the mouse cursor' game, a game that is fast to get into, and even faster to get out of. Finally, while it may not be as hard as Hotline Miami, Savant is still pretty challenging. But that is exactly why I would still suggest picking it up. I mean... its only 2 dollars! When games are cheap and have such a great amount of polish on them like Savant does, it‚Äôs hard to say no.

What I thought I was going to do:I bought 'Papers, Please' thinking that it was going to be, one of the games on my steam library that I would launch for maybe 30 minutes to get the feel of it, appreciate what they were trying to do, and then close out of it to never open it again.What actually happened:Upon opening the game you are greeted with the title bouncing up and down to what I can only assume, is the most communist sounding piece of music ever made by mankind. How this starts is with your character winning the labor lottery, yay? At the beginning of everyday you read the newspaper and depending on what is happening in the world, it will directly affect your game play. But, at the same time, you are an immigration inspector and your job is to control who gets to enter the country. So with rebels and recitalists teeming everywhere, your game play controls the future of the country, so what you do today in the game will heavily affect tomorrow. Aside from general mechanics though, the story is great and at times shocking. The characters have a sense of grit and feel real to the point where you will feel like the bad guy multiple times. And finally, believe it or not, the world is immersive. There are people from other countries and at that desk of yours, no matter whom they are, they are at their most venerable state. Buy this game; seriously, it‚Äôs an addictive experience you won‚Äôt regret it.One last note:This is NOT a point and click. Trust me, some people would like to call it that but there are too many other things going on, and with no clear goal because the game has 20 different endings most people are calling it an 'Adventure Game'.Have fun!

Portal 2 is an amazing game which combines top notch puzzle platforming with an amazing and immersive story line. Originally I was thinking of comparing this game to something with an equally good story line, perhaps an older game, such as one of the Ledged of Zelda‚Äôs or Pok√©mon red or gold. But being honest, this game is just generally better. Portal 2 will make you happy and laugh as well as make you want to throw your computer out of the window in rage. And by the end of the game, if you have been actually paying attention to detail, you just might find yourself shedding a manly tear. It‚Äôs a game like no other and I may dare to even go so far to call it a master piece that once you play it, you will never forget it, for the rest of your life. I am sorry to sing its praises if you were just scanning these reviews trying to find the one guy who hates this game, but the truth is‚Ä? that one guy doesn‚Äôt exist. It‚Äôs really just that good.

Oh god, it‚Äôs Hotline Miami! Where the heck do I even start with this game? Well, have you ever had a dream of being a professional assassin in the 80‚Äôs, wearing a jacket similar to the one you got from your football team in high school, and upon entering some random house, uninvited and filled with people you have never met before, you brutally murder every single person? No? WELL TO F***ING BAD! This game looks like it could have ran on the Super Nintendo with its colorful art style, aside from all the blood, and guts... and occasionally brains! This game is messed up! And you never quite know what‚Äôs going on in this world. You just get oddly coded messages on your phone that essentially tell you to go murder people. So that‚Äôs what-cha you do! The best part about this game is finishing an area that has frustrated you TO NO END. There isn‚Äôt a certain amount of lives so when you die you just restart the entire floor of the house you‚Äôre in. The houses can be filled with up to, maybe even more than 20 guys. And your character can die just as easily as them, if not, even easier. Sometimes you have to finish enemies off by bashing their heads into the floor over and over again or shoving your thumbs into their eye sockets (Gross)! But when it comes to you, one hit and you‚Äôre a dead man. You‚Äôre no Master Chief sitting behind a rock waiting for your shield to charge back up. The game is extremely unforgiving. When you lose, everything resets. And when you enter a room with people in it, no matter the number, you better be FREAKING FAST and make sure to kill the GUY or GUYS with the GUNS FIRST! When you win, you‚Äôre a god among men! When you lose, well the way that the game will depict your dead pixelated corpse with its blood and parts of his brain all over the floor, pretty much says it all on its own.So if you like buckets of pixelated blood, feeling like a one man tactical genius army, and being a psychotic merciless mercenary from the 80‚Äôs. This is the game for you! And at the low price of only 10 dollars (not to mention when the game goes 50% off on steam sales), I personally would nag anyone to buy this game. So do it! Buy hotline Miami! ‚Ä¶It‚Äôs good for your soul damn it!

This is a great game! But it‚Äôs a hard one to recommend. Let me explain. It‚Äôs a 2-D MOBA. Yeah, you know, a MOBA like Dota or League of Legends. But regardless of only having 2 dimensions instead of 3, this game is actually ridiculously fun. Characters are very diverse in how they look, how they play, and there voice acting. Some characters in this game even have the voices of ‚Äúfamous internet celebrities‚Ä? However, I put that in quotes because if you don‚Äôt use YouTube for gaming recommendations/reviews or playthroughs, you will have no idea who these people are.If you think other MOBA‚Äôs are to hard, and their communities have to many a-holes, this is the game for you. And at the small price of 5 dollars when it goes on sale, it would be foolish to not pick this gem up and give it a test drive. Plus they update the game and continue to add new and crazy characters every once in a while so that the game never gets old. In short, it‚Äôs a steal, buy it.

I cannot even fathom how they thought it would be okay to sell every gun in this game as DLC, it really ruins it for me honestly. =/ Every good skin, every outfit, all the nice trinkets, all overpriced DLC, not even reasonably priced. I got the super deluxe edition on Christmas sale expecting to have all the DLC and it included almost nothing good! I'm just... so disappointed by Rebellion on this one.Give this game a miss it's a MASSIVE cash grab, there is no content to be had here unless you're up for spending 100+ bucks on a zombie shooter.Games that could have been good but sell every single bit of content as DLC should be shunned and need to stop. You'd expect it from EA but not anyone else. This is an insulting disgrace and waste of a game.
Are you into rhythm games? Do you like games that force you to dance to be good at them? Do you have enough money to buy a VR headset as well as buying this game?Then this is the VR game for you!

This game is a total grind fest. Bland story, bland characters, bland graphics, bland weapons, bland combat, it's just bland. There's no drive or motive to do anything, gun and weapon upgrades consist of name changes and minor stat increases, the whole game runs by a generic level system, every map is a very dull generated maze, the list goes on. There's just no character to this game like the first one had so I can't even say anything good about it. It's fine if you have some time to burn and have a spare 20 bucks I guess but I can't possibly recommend it.I am sure you can find something way more fun to play so keep on looking.

There is enough praise for how solid and fluid the game is, yes it's well made and polished, but why do none of the thumb up reviews address just how insanely grindy this game is!? It has gotten to the point where it is so absurdly repetitive that I am not sure I can force myself to get through the whole game anymore. x.x I want to say great things about how well made the game is but in about 10 hours of gameplay you will be sick of playing this and beg for content I promise you that. And here are the major reasons why.SHALLOW REPEATING GRINDY CONTENTLet me give you a breif rundown of the content you can expect in this game so I don't sound like I am rambling to much. There are 3 guns in the game, a close range but risky shotgun, a high fire rate but inaccurate smg and a slow but powerful pistol, that's it, each tier they just look cool and have better numbers. There are 4 zombie enemies in the game and 2 bug type enemies and a wiggly thing, all of them you can combat perfectly by running backwards and holding down the shoot button, that is litterly the only tactic you need in the game, each tier they just get tougher and look different. As for the base? It always looks the same, you always need to micro it the same, nothing ever changes, you just tediously micro the power, repairing the core, research and build new stuff, once you have done it once or twice that is it, the micromanagement in the game will only become monotonous from that point on. There are 4 tiers of doing all this same stuff over and over, grinding like crazy like your in some kind of MMORPG before you are 'allowed' to beat the game, you tell me if that's not repetitive and heck or not.It's truly disheartening when the game will always be the same way no matter how many hours you burn into it and no matter how good and experience you get with it's mechanics, the same tiny amount of content is all it has to offer you when you truly just wish for more. After the first 10 hours you will have experienced all the fun the game can offer you and after that it's only 10-20 more hours of the exact same thing over and over again... same guns, same equipment, same freaking dumb zombie enemies, it truly becomes a chore. This could have easily been fixed if it wasn‚Äôt so darn long and monotonous. =/MAKING PROGRESS IS A MASSIVE CHORE After 20 hours of gameplay I barely even moved past the -first- tier, I don't even know how that's possible but the first three starting locations just took so freaking long due to having to go back and forth on the train for oxygen, thermal or to drop off loot due to having crappy starting equipment. The only way to do this less is to get to the next tier, which would be simple... if I knew where the data chips to do that even where! The first two chips I found which took going through and entire location each where for the farm and mine which are useless without teir 2 engineering and research and by the time I even found those I was sick of the game already and furious that I found those last. This happened because the game doesn‚Äôt tell you where the chips you want/need actually are, only hinting to where chips might be in story journals so I was mostly a lost sheep hitting my head against the wall for hours and actually getting almost nowhere. The tier system in this game is laboriously slow and very poorly planned, I would have preferred if they rail roaded me along a linear path so I was getting the upgrades I needed first to actually make progress, instead they bomb you with a pile of places you can go to, no hint to where are better places to go, you go to them, waste tons of time going through them just to end up with no idea where to go next after doing them anyway and not having the chips you need to tier. Anyone can admit this is a awful system and makes no sense, if I didn't get annoyed enough to look up a guide to a location I -should- have been at I probably would have never got to tier 2 and been overrun with 'space zombies' even faster then I did after 20 hours of wasted time and having to give up as every location was overrun by that point and it was taking to long to make anymore progress.This might just sound like I was a clueless moron but I was just going into the game hoping to have a good time, why should you have to read guides so you don't completely fail your first run and have an awful time? Playing video games is my only pass time so if this happened to me then it can happen to anyone playing for their first time and that is a very flawed game.A MEANS TO AN ENDThere is nothing meaningful about playing this game so why should it waste so much of your time on the same monotonous game loop? I have no clue but the developer seemed to think it was a great idea making you have to go over the same shallow combat, enemies, equipment and base micromanagement for 4 long, slow tiers. I am so fed up with the game is just want to finish it so I can uninstall it at this point and that is truly a shame cas I did enjoy this game for the first 5 hours but that 'fun' ran out way quicker then I hoped and now doing anything in this game just feels like a means to an end to a very very grindy repetitive experience. I bet you anything if you made someone play this for a week straight they would go completely insaneSHUT UP AND CONCLUDE THIS NONSENSESure I got my 10 dollars out of this game but by no means should you ever buy this at full price, as I have already clearly mentioned there is not enough content to even justify for how long the game goes for before you can even finish it in the first place, even WoW is less repetitive then this game. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this to anyone with a job, a gf or a life that's for sure, there is no way you will have enough time to get through it properly unless you follow a guide to a tee. Unless you have like 20 to 40+ hours to burn on 5 hours of game content then I would just play something else honestly that at least feels like it has meaningful content grind.Thanks for reading if you did, I am going to follow a guide of someone that has more patience then most sane people and move on in my life. x.x

Disregard my old review, the Gungeons and Draguns update has made this game significantly more fair, generous and a TON more fun to play co-op!  Me and my friend managed to finish it on one run! The addition of gun/passive synergies add SO much more fun power to almost any weapon and item, it‚Äôs just so satisfying and interesting finding combo after new combo every run, making what would be normally almost useless meh guns into beast cannons. It keeps the game variety refreshing even if you are not doing great. Synergies and more drops at least give you a fighting chance now.The more hardcore players still have plenty of options to make their runs much harder while other types of players that want a reasonable challenge, like me, can enjoy how crazy and OP weapons and items can get with synergies. It‚Äôs good fun to have in small doses now with the update. Gotta give it to the devs, the G&D update did fix the problems I and a lot of others had with the game to a large degree, good job Dodge Roll. All the quality of life additions are just perfect and really add to the gameplay flow~I‚Äôll keep this short and sweet and end it by saying if you like a challenging game that rewards patience and skill with satisfaction, then is the rogue-like for you now. If you want something easy and relaxing or something you can play in any mood, this game won‚Äôt ever do that for you. Not for the faint of heart but good fun if you want to play it well.It‚Äôs such a big change after the update I rewrote my review entirely and went from a total thumbs down to a thumbs up, take that as you will‚Ä?

Short review: Don't buy this game if you don't want to be frustrated like hell and keep being kicked while your down with a million unwinnable situations thrown at you.Long rant review: I was hoping for a pretty cool experiance with this game but all I was doing was face palming non stop. I can't even believe the developers somehow thought it was okay to have SO many unwinnable situations, again and again it keeps throwing things at you that are impossible to beat or preapre for becuase how the heck can you know they are coming? I've litterly given up at this point, catch a load of this BS. Your daughter suddenly costs 20k to be cured of her sickness, note that making money that early in the game is near impossible.Then right on that same mission, your son needs 15 thousands for school, are you kidding me?! Then your daughter dies cas you will never get that much money and everyone is sad, you can't pay the sons uni so he drops out with a 2k fine but then he asks you for an absurd amount of money AGAIN, 15k to leave the country and go somewhere else, then when you don't pay that, which you can't becuase it's an impossible amount of money to earn, he goes off and gets killed doing a robbery, gets you a 5 thousand dollar fine for being found out, a 1.5k bill for the funeral and 1k bill after that for paperwork. This has to be a joke surely, it completely destroyed all my progress on 3 unwinnable situations in a row and ive lost all ability to care or even try with the game from that point on, it just completely screwed me unfairly.What the hell is this game?! This game is nothing but a hopelessness simulator, all you do is chase your tail non stop, you achieve NOTHING, you can't make any progress becuase the game dosen't want you to for some reason. Every time you earn money the game unfairly strips you of it for no reason at all based on nothing you did wrong or could have known you did wrong. The only way to seem to get anywhere in this game is to just be evil as all hell and rat everyone in, ive been doing that alot and it still seems barely worth it. I've played this for 4 hours now and I still have no idea how to avoid the bullsht that it keeps throwing at me.It will keep putting you in situations you can't win due to having no prior knowledge to prepare and it won't do this a couple of times nah it will keep doing it -the entire game through-, I have no idea what kind of game design this is or why it's like this but it's actually not cool. =/ Obviously playing on the recommended 'challenging' difficulty is a terrible, awful bad idea, I haven't had as frustrating of a progress backtracking time like this game since This war of mine. I would almost pay 10 dollars just to not play a game as annoying as this honestly that's how aggrevated I am after quitting out when an old lady darts me in the head for a reason I didn't know I had, my character just admitted to something he did in the past and she kills you on the spot and there is NOTHING you can about it other then pay an insane 500 rep which I didn't have cas I needed it for cameras to do my job! I don't even, I could go on about these unwinnable situations all day as they just keep coming.Can't possibly recommend this ugh of a game, get it if your desperate or curious I guess but be warned, and play on the trainee difficulty for the first run cas I promise you it will be very frustrating and make not a single lick of sense, make you feel like an idiot and feel like it's wasting your time. =/If your curious to know more your welcome to message me and such too, this game has nothing but perfect examples of why it's frustrating I'm not just writing this cas I can't 'git gud' there is no way to git gud at this game unless you went through it like 10 times, found all the right choices and chose them in the perfect order, how the hell is that fun?! How is that even a game? Repeating yourself to make progress is not gameplay and never should be.banana out of 10, what even is this game...

I think it's about time I re-wrote my review for this game cas the last one was just an angry rant about things that needed balancing and smoothing out which they are now, so yea, I should suck it up and change it.Company of Heroes 2 has been one of my favourite RTS games for afew years now, almost 2 to 3 now if I‚Äôm correct and deserves way more love then the rant I gave it before. I'm really good at it now, everything is balanced, everything is manageable and don't get frustrated by anything much then spammy AI so yea anyway I'm gonna write a short and sweet opinion review for this now instead to give it the recommendation it deservesThe goodIt's a very solid RTS nowGreat faction selection now if you buy all the DLC's, get them on great salesGreat unit variety, especially with the All Units modGood map selection now to keep you interestedRespectable graphics and physics engine even up to nowKept the not perfect but innovative cover system from CoH1Added new mechanics that you either like or don't, the cold systemAmazing community, great free mods and skins to choose from, including maps!Good game dynamic and flow through the early game, mid and late game tiersPerfect to play competitively or casual reallySurprisingly fantastic replayability, every single match will feel different if you change the maps aroundThe Bad:Doesn‚Äôt run particularly well, even on my GTX 980 with 32Gbs of RAMNo SLI support for a poorly running gameGame performance plummets near end of game, terribad optimizationBalancing can sometimes get funky, one month a unit can be great then useless the next month after an updateThe Frustrating:Oberkommando West can easily get overpowered if you let them, so don't let themEnemy AI on highest difficulty clearly cheats resources and unit spam most of the time, outsmart themDoesn‚Äôt save match XP if your internet is down or doesn‚Äôt connect to game server for some reason, always stay connectedThings actually just not making sense logically, but they do balance wise. Such as a tank with a powerful gun shooting a half track but it takes the shot and just drives away. Or especially, armoured cars and half-tracks being able to be damaged by small arms fire, pretty silly.Conclusion of this review war:As you can see by the many hours I‚Äôve played this game once you know all the factions and all the units you can hop in and have an RTS blast with friends or by yourself with AI. Caring about World War 2 history will help you enjoy this game significantly more of course, but not required at all especially since it's not exactly realistic in any sense, such as tanks and infantry having health and sometimes being really inaccurate for no reason.I give it a solid 9 / 10 really, it has the whole formula that makes a true, enjoyable RTS game and I hope Relic works on a third instalment eventually in the next few years cas it can only get better from here now that they have fundamentally fixed and added good variety to the game.

Good luck finding an actual serious review here, lol. I recently just came back to read a useless pile of text I gave on this game AGES ago and feel I should at least write something way more helpful and meaningful to make up for that, just in case people are actually still buying this game and want more info to go on. As much as I want to make this review unobjective as possible I just can't cas it creeped me out WAY to much, so yea take it lightly and take into account many other reviews before making a decision please, that's how you do it, one review/experience is never enough to fully understand what a game is.And as always my reviews are NOT reviews in the typical sense, the word 'review' has almost lost all meaning on steam, just look at how many useless reviews there are on most games and how many are actually just jokes and you will see what I mean. Anyway take my 'reviews' how you want to cas I don't even know what to call them, written first impressions? experience reviews? Feedback reviews? Concluding notes? None of them are coined terms so I dunno.Why I did not enjoy this game at all:> Incredibly disturbing> Way to basic gameplay> Uninteresting art style> Absurdly repetitive> Makes you feel really... depressed =(> Will probably keep you up at night> Unfair death and progress system> Relies way to much on random luck just to win> Some enemies are to predictable while some are just so unfair> Odd game pacing> Rooms are way to small and restrictive> No difficulty setting for those that just want to have funBasic conclusion:If you hadn‚Äôt already realized how very dark, depraved and downright freaking weird this game is from the screen shots then here is a mega quick rundown. You play as a little kid in a dungeon of death shooting tears, blood and other gross body fluids to fight abominations to stay alive, getting upgrades that mutilate his body and killing horrific boss after boss all to get to the end and kill his abusive mother that wants to kill him because 'god told her to'. Yep that's uh, actually what it's about, somehow. Avoid this game if creepy stuff is not your thing. If incredibly high, intense and mostly unfair difficulty annoys you. If dying and losing all your progress time after time frustrates you or if relying on pure luck just to win makes you feel like there is no point in even bothering to play the game and 'be good' in the first place then read some other negative reviews and don't ever get this, Yep that's pretty much it.Just cas it's not for me at all doesn‚Äôt mean it's not for anyone I know that, I just like to warn people like me that there is alot to avoid if you‚Äôre really not into games with a super dark theme and humour like this and also games that expect you to put like 50+ hours in just to be good enough and know enough to actually win, yes im talking about you most rouge-likes =/. I didn't realize how bad it was until I got afew hours in then I just couldn‚Äôt stand playing it anymore for the reasons I listed above, sorry.0 out of be weary of this game.Shame I couldn‚Äôt enjoy it like all the positive review people did but it is what it is. Hope this experience review helped someone. Always happy for any feedback or discussion comments too. I plan to write more professionally if anyone finds my experience reviews handy but I don‚Äôt know if anyone does if they don‚Äôt tell me!

Yep, I have to be one of those people again and find a game alot of peeps like, buy it, and hate every moment of it. Anyway I do have a ton of legitimate reasons as to why I thoroughly have not been able to enjoy this game even after 6 - 9 hours, read on if you actually care, do it for your own sake if you‚Äôre thinking of getting this.THE GAME IS WAY TOO DARN HARD FOR HOW SIMPLE IT IS! First and foremost I was shocked when I first got into the game how absurdly hard and unfair it was right from the start. I really can't express in words just how frustratingly awkwardly difficult this game is. I don't think ive ever even played a rogue lite this hard before in my life! And All I do is play games, even see my steam library. The small tutorial barely tells you how to make ships properly, what good weapon combos their might be or how things work, how important ship balancing and equal thrusters are, nope just the controls and how to put parts on other parts making the game seem soooo simple and casual, but holy frick it so isn‚Äôt. It doesn‚Äôt even explain for a second that there is a colour system for higher tiered stuff! Yea sure that's maybe a given if you know anything about game rarity systems but I wanted to express just how pathetic of a tutorial there is. Expect to go in very confused, blind and lost, cas I could never figure out fully how to not dire horribly to stupid unbalanced crap over and over even after 6 hours. It tells you nothing and throws you into hell, pitted against bigger beefed ships you have no hope of winning against without some serious fire power, which you hardly ever find in decent amounts, and expects you to get anywhere, it's just such a silly, lazy development decision to do that. I get the whole 'just jump right in and play and learn as you go! No having to mess about in a stupid lame tutorial' concept, it's an interesting one to keep using in indie games but not for every game, it's mostly only ever felt right to me in survival games like Don't Starve and even then it can be hard to justify such lack of information to the player to get in and actually be able to play properly. This kind of humiliating and frustrating experience I have had so far has all been on the darn easiest difficulty too, easy! I do not even want to fathom the BS and aggravation that would have to be endured from higher difficulty levels, I wouldn‚Äôt wish it on my worst enemy. This game is making me feel like such an idiot that knows nothing about games every freaken run I try! it's depressing and frankly not fun in the slightest. =/ The visuals of the game make it seem so giddy, happy and casual but let me make it clear that it really, REALLY isn‚Äôt, this game will kick your archsloff and it won't care how bad it makes you feel every time it does it. Your expectations will be blown to hell after looking at this game every single time you die, and you will die alot until your either fed up and write a review, like me, smash your computer to pieces or cry in a corner, either one.The devs need to do some serious overhauling of the game balance and expectations of you fighting higher level enemies to go up a stage cas right now it's just brutal and a joke. You don't have any other way to go up a stage by the way, you have to fight and absurdly powerful ship way higher level then you with way more firepower and armour and beat it, that's fine and all, if you were evenly matched with it, but you never are and never will be, so it's like jumping into a pit of snakes and dancing around hoping not to be bitten pretty much. I could go on about how stupidly, brutally unfair and hard the game is even on easy but you should probably get the point I‚Äôm trying to make. If you don't like hard games and were thinking of buying this well then I hope you were lucky enough to read this my friend and not go through the pain I‚Äôve put myself through to make a point that's not even worthwhile making. I shouldn‚Äôt have to ever prove myself to a darn game, it should prove itself against me! I paid for the flipping thing, if I want an easy run so I can actually make progress then why can't I?! I just feel ripped off so much right now and that even buying this time waster on sale makes me feel like a sucker. =/THE GAME IS FAR TOO SIMPLE FOR THE PRICE TAGThe entire budget clearly went into the art style and audio cas holy heck there is almost nothing to do in this game but shove pieces together hoping they work right and pew pew at other ships floating around hoping to kill them, that's it! There is almost no progression system either, you unlock new ship part kits by going up through the levels then unlock others by using new kits you unlocked to unlock the next one by getting to level x, it's actually frankly a pain in the tush cas if your new ship kit sucks and is made of parts that are almost downright useless, you are kinda stuck with them until you actually make it to the level it wants you to get to with them before you can get a better starting ship, what kind of annoying progression system is that crap?! Why not base it on kills? or how many parts you collect up? or if you make a cool big ship? nope, just boring get to this level and you get a kit. After 6 hours not only am I frustrated as hell with repeating such nonsense over and over, but I‚Äôm bored of it too and wish I had my money back to buy something enjoyable, ugh. The game may look great, has fantastic effects, voices and sound but my god the lack of gameplay absolutely kills it in every way, for me at least and alot of people without god like patience I‚Äôll bet.Death after death you rarely learn anything new because there IS nothing to learn new, the game is too simple, it's just float around and shoot so what am I darn missing?! The game will drive you crazy with it's somehow over complicated super simplified gameplay that doesn‚Äôt ever try to help you improve or LET you improve, it will just keep killing you over and over with bull crap and give you next to nothing for your wasted time, not a single, not a bit of advice, just a kick in the nuts and a restart as a brand new hunk of junk. If you‚Äôre looking for a repetitive, shallow rogue lite game that's hardly satisfying in any way, shape or form then look no further really!CONCLUSIONI could go on about all the exact things that frustrated me non stop in this 'game' but I ran out of typing room, darnit, so this will have to be it. I‚Äôm sure I made a point to a degree cas I sure would have appreciated a warning like this before I brought this stupidly hard game. Can't possibly recommend this game due to so much frustration, it's way to shallow and unfair and demands a level of skill that has no place existing in such a simple game. The devs really need to fix the difficulty curve cas it's bonkers. 3/10, stay away if you want to keep your sanity. x.x Get it super cheap on sale for no more then 5 dollars, cas that's all the fun your going to get out of it im afraid just for a quick reminder of how a video game can make you look and feel stupid.

Blood and gore in a violent video game about war should be bog standard and expected in video games now days, not a 'privilege' you should pay extra for, nobody can really disagree with that I mean come on seriously. Do we want games to get to the point where you have to pay for save games soon or the 'ultra' graphics setting?! How far will this greed go if we let it? This should be grilled, brought to attention and laughed over throughly so no other devs try to pull this crap. I hope Total Biscuit gets on this soon cas this is everything he strives to STOP, lmao.Hope the blood looks good cas man does having to buy this just to make the battles look like how they SHOULD have suck. =/ The RTS battles are still rather tedious, slow, sluggish and dull and I was hoping for alot more then this 'DLC' to make them more exciting but ah well, heres hoping they don't sell us more features of the game that should have been in there for free along the line...Also down recommend of course cas... just why?

The Universe is awfully lonely... or is it?As the namesake implies this game plays on the ideas of Enrico Fermi who suggested in casual conversation that;"Any civilization with a modest amount of rocket technology and an immodest amount of imperial incentive could rapidly colonize the entire galaxy." Which raises the question - why haven't we found anyone like us yet?There could be a multitude of reasons for this and this game displays them in a fun and intuitive way and more importantly a well presented and easy to understand way! This game is both somewhat a strategy but mostly an educational what-if tool to understand how life may evolve and why the vastness of space is a large barrier between discovering other life among the stars. These reasons could be;.Aliens decided to never visit due to the difficulty of travelling across the void - perhaps they have more of a knowledge of Physics and our dreams of deep space traversal are merely just science-fiction. We're already struggling to tackle problems of habitation in low orbit and beyond..Aliens simply decided to not visit us. Perhaps we're no where near the scale of civilization that's worthy of contact. I would like some reference to the Kardashev Scale in the game..Other civilizations have only just recently become sentient or space faring and perhaps have sent messages or visitors that just won't arrive within our lifetime. The Human race has only been around for around 300,000 years - perhaps in the timescale of the universe this just isn't long enough for anything meaningful to happen.And many more questions and scenarios and even theories can be demonstrated in this game. For instance I had a species that was so militant that when they discovered other species they instantly killed them, akin to the Dark Forest theory proposed in the brilliant Sci-Fi Novel 'The Dark Forest' by Liu Cixin. Perhaps it's better that other species don't know about us...Or another game I had a harsh reminder of The Great Barrier theory, I had 3 separate races all who had to endure multiple extinction level events, some made it... most didn't. The Earth in it's past has had it's fair share of extinction events, perhaps that was our test? Perhaps we've surpassed the great barrier? Thanks Mr. Dinosaur.All in all, if the philosophy of alien life and the universe fascinates you, this is the game for you. It's still not finished, granted, but it's a fun experience nonetheless.

Project Zomboid is like no other Zombie survival or Apocalypse simulator on the market. The game combines tense survival gameplay with extremely deep and realistic mechanics that are perfectly embroided together, in order to create a satisfying and immersive survival sandbox.Project Zomboid is set in 1990s Kentucky, USA. With famous towns such as Muldraugh and now thanks to the recent release of Build 41 on the main branch - Louisville! As you can imagine a game that is trying to include an entire state will have a massive map and you'd not be surprised to find out that you can try and survive in a huge open map. You will need cars to get around effectively unless you're prepared for some dangerous multi-day treks through the wilderness in order to avoid wandering hordes on the main highways and roads.The beauty of this game aside from the sheer depth and learning curve is your journey to gain more experience each character. You will die, and you will die a lot. This game does not pull punches, the virus can only spread to you through blood and saliva transmission (Which is customize-able in the sandbox settings, more on that later). which essentially means, if you get bit by the infected - you're a dead man walking. Even scratches and cuts from the infected have a chance to carry the virus into your blood stream. But a bite? That's a certainty. Get your affairs in order and paint the ceiling with a nearby shotgun.The infected are dangerous, this is a constant threat, a constant fear. You may think the shambling dead pose not much of a threat, they're slower than you when you walk but in numbers? Or if you let your guard down? Complacency is the number one killer. Make no mistake, do not underestimate the walking dead. Remember when you start the game it mentions "This is how you died." It might take minutes, it may take hours, some it may take months or years but there is no hope for survival and everyone succumbs eventually. Whether it's the walking dead or something else - everyone dies. Which is why this game is so brutally good! At the end of the day you're playing a regular old joe. Survival skills? What are those. You just came from a 9 to 5 bucko!This leads me onto character creation. At the start of your save or if you join a multiplayer server (More on MP later). You will be prompted to create your survivor. Firstly it will ask what your pre-outbreak occupation and skills are. Some examples of which are;.Unemployed - A blank slate, you might be a lazy bugger but hey you have some skills that employers didn't find useful in society! This occupation allows you to pick and choose traits starting you off with 8 points to spend..Veteran - You were in the military, at some point. You've seen some stuff and walking dead ain't gonna shine a torch on Medina Ridge. You might struggle to sleep but slaying some zombies? A cake walk..Burger Flipper - Good news! Being a minimum wage worker has some great benefits when wage doesn't matter anymore! You know your way around sharp implements and can cook some mean rabbit burgers for your pals!.Burglar - Sneaky, nimble and able to steal cars. Being a criminal has it's perks even after society breaks down!These are a few examples of occupations and some perks that they come with. Alongside this are plenty of positive and negative perks you can pick and choose in true RPG fashion. Remember children, Smoking is a free +4 perk points! It's the 90s cigarettes and lighters are more abundant than you could even imagine. After you've sorted out your perks, you then get to choose your appearance or just randomize it. You pick your physical features and what you were wearing when the world went to hell. Clothing, traits and every in between is incredibly important. Remember when I said the game was deep? Well it simulates body temperature, blood vessels and clothes even offer different amounts of bite and scratch protection depending on the material it is made out of. Your hair? Yeah that dynamically grows as you survive and can be cut or trimmed with scissors and a razor.The longer you survive the more you see nature take over and erode man made structures, if you manage to survive to around the 6 month mark, civilization looks like it's gone full blown I am Legend. Vines, cracks and vegetation take over buildings and it looks amazing. Truly some Last of Us Post-apocalyptic vibes. This erosion also affects the undead. The longer you live, the more they degrade. I mean they're corpses after all, they decompose and break down. Unfortunately we can't pull a 28 weeks later and wait for them to die out. That won't cut it this time, but it was a neat idea!Thanks to the release of Build 41 which is a complete redesign and rethink of the entire game. Build 40 is an entirely different game. Some people may think that the devs taking 2 years to release Build 41 is ridiculous... but they redesigned and rebuilt the entire game's code and netcode back up from scratch and made the game the masterpiece it is today. Bear in mind that Build 41 has been playable in Singleplayer for 2 years, the main release includes final features and MP. Now this build is out the way the next updates are in full swing. Build 42 is set to include animals that appear in the world, such as deer for hunting or wolves and bears to hunt you. If you've been intrigued so far, well let me tell you if you're interested you can now experience everything - with up to another 31 players! Multiplayer Zomboid is a beautiful experience. It may not be as tense as going at it alone but it certainly is heaps of fun! I highly recommend it.In order to wrap this up I'll quickly cover the sandbox I brushed over earlier. Project Zomboid is completely customizable. The loot pool, the zombies, how the virus spreads or doesn't spread. It's all up to you. You make the experience you want to survive. Maybe you don't want shamblers and you want blind but lighting fast sprinter zombies with super acute hearing. You can do that. You must hate yourself, but you can do that. All in all, if you're looking for an immensely deep and customize-able Zombie Apocalypse simulator with incredible and realistic mechanics and now MP! Project Zomboid is absolutely for you. I cannot recommend this game more, I've owned it for years and to see what it is today, it never ceases to amaze me. This is the one folks, this is the indie gem for the survival genre. Infinite replayability (and it has workshop support :) )

Ready or Not is a worthy (Although not official) successor to the famed SWAT 3 and 4. Purely tactical, extremely tense and difficult but rewarding. This Ladies and Gentlemen is the true SWAT Tactical experience brought to life with more modern tools and approaches that we could of only dreamed of whilst playing SWAT 4.Firstly, I would like to preface that this is an early access review - the game is in it's early stages, missing content, features and general polish. However if you're interested in this game and are willing to drop the asking price, this game is absolutely worth it. Right now as of this review, I've only experienced the PvE experience, however a PvP experience is said to be featured at a later date. Biased as I may be the PvE is where this game is for me anyway.Which leads nicely onto the PvE experience. Ready or Not features multiple maps each with multiple gamemodes or situations, namely being Barricaded Suspects, Raid, Active Shooter, Bomb Threat and Hostage situation. These gamemodes are all unique in both the way the maps are laid out and the methodology required in order to take them on both effectively and more importantly - successfully. This game is HARD do not be dismayed when first starting out, you will fail, many times.Ready or Not features both Singleplayer with AI teammates and a Multiplayer element. The AI is pretty decent in it's current stage but does need some tweaking here and there, nothing unusual. They're fairly competent and know how to cover angles and perform room clearance without much input from the player. On the other hand is Multiplayer, up to 5 players. This game is an absolute blast with your friends, teamwork is absolutely mandatory and great communication is a gel that binds a plan together. I've not had a more fun tactical experience with my buddies for a long long time and this game certainly scratches an itch in that regard that I thought would not be scratched for a good while.Another thing that stood out to me over the course of playing was the sound design. It is absolutely FANTASTIC. When I use a breaching charge I feel like my organs have shifted, it is pure bass. It is glorious. It reverbs and it contorts through the environment, it does exactly what it should, and the firearms behave the same, it is amazing to experience. Albeit loud but hey it's 'mersion.Whilst I could continue to sing praises about this game, there are some downsides so far that I should address. (Please bear in mind that these are most likely already going to be addressed due to the early access nature and I'm really just clutching at straws here). As of now the arsenal and gadgets at the player's disposal is quite limited - I expect this to change over the course of development. I would also like to see bots as an optional addition in Multiplayer games, maybe you don't have 5 people and could do with an extra AI or more to order around and provide assistance. Players should be able to designate AI to be ordered around in order to fill extra slots.Other than to continue listing lack of content that is almost guaranteed to be added throughout development such as more maps and things of that nature, I'm going to close it here. This game is absolutely worth the money. You may see it and think that the price is steep, well let me tell you - it's a small team that has made a AAA quality product and their attention to detail and realism is exactly what it should be. People are not exaggerating when they say it is SWAT 5. It is what we've been waiting for. It is a truly tactical joy. I cannot recommend it more.

Highfleet gives me so many emotions.It's Space Afghanistan, fighting the Space Taliban (Rebels of your Empire and Great Houses supplying them).It's Dune af.It's huge airships with large crews slugging it out.It's Strategic and meaningful.I. Love. It.

SuchArt: Genius Art Simulator places you into the far future where the totally non-totalitarian Human regime has deemed that your DNA has Artistic potential!  Whether that is an exact science or not is entirely up for debate.The game simulates paint extremely intuitively and realistically as well as offering many tools for an aspiring artist to create true masterpieces in their pursuit of fame and fortune. My one wish for the game is that they add sculpting and wood carving that would make my terrible masterful art so much more expressive!Unfortunately however the game whilst controls perfectly fine and quite well on mouse and keyboard doesn't seem to have any drawing tablet support - I may be wrong though! But just be aware if that's your intention.In short this game is absolutely worth the buy whether you are creative or not, it's a fun sandbox.

The Hind is a great EA release. It's fun as hell to fly, maintains its realistic quirks - as I am told, and boasts a great selection of pew pews for pilots and operators to blow some stuff up with. The functional fan adds at least 23.76% combat effectiveness when turned on, the only thing missing is I appear to be in 2021 and not 1980s Afghanistan - on the bright side those pesky Mujahideen can't hit me with Stingers!

Snowrunner is a sequel to Mudrunner and originally Spintires. Snowrunner takes the series from being a tech demo to a full fledged experience, this is not just a driving simulator, it is an open-ended puzzle game. Figuring how to get from A-B when nature really hates you. It's an interesting dynamic of preparing and planning but inevitably creating impromptu solutions to problems as they arise. Stuck in unexpected mud? Use that winch and hope that tree is strong enough for your truck. Fallen through a cracked ice lake? Drown. Flipped your Jeep? Hope you have an autonomous winch or without that engine you ain't getting back up on your own. In Snowrunner the game consists of a large selection of maps each having primary objectives and side objectives. There are enough to keep you going for 100s of hours, easily. Most maps start out with you going around discovering paths and areas and repairing broken bridges, rockfalls and other obstacles in order to traverse the map with big heavy trucks, a whole lot easier. The main objectives are dependant on the map, and can lead from rebuilding an oil operation to building a whole rocket in a Russian cosmodrome...I've not experience nearly any of that yet, but I'm eagerly anticipating getting to it. At the time of review I've only played 6 hours and in singleplayer but there is a 4 player COOP! In COOP players help the host complete objectives. Players can bring their own trucks from their own games but do not progress in their own world. Although to add incentive to this, they still make money and XP from missions whether new or they have already done it.This moves us on to vehicles and upgrades. Snowrunner has a large selection of vehicles, from Big boy trucks to little boy trucks and scout 4x4s. All fun in their own right and each having an extensive upgrade tree. Upgrades obviously cost money but more importantly are locked behind levels, preventing the player from getting good upgrades and making the game a whole lot easier from the get go. XP is the name of the game and this sweet nectar gets you a whole lot closer to getting good Mud tires and a beefed up engine for destroying that dirty dirty, well... dirt.This game really surprised me. I wasn't expecting to have to use my brain as much but sometimes to solutions to your problems are oh so satisfying. I hope to have some COOP experiences soon, having other people helping would be great - but single-player itself is brilliant. Highly recommended.

Vrchat oh boi Vrchat, there's a reason this is my most played game. this game has probably been one of the influential games in my life since halo. in vrchat you are able to meet people from all over the world from all sorts of communities. vrchat has let me experience the heart of meme, anime, brony, and furry communities and others learning alot about internet culture i didn't know much about in the first place while making some of the best friends i've ever had. i've been playing since before the knuckles meme hype and the friends i've even made even back then still talk to me today we've even made an effort to meet in real life. vrchat has a very welcoming community and i would recommend it to anyone who has a hard time making friends in their area it maybe intimidating it may be hard but you can make friends in this game and make real connections with others. the experience is multiplied ten fold when you finally get vr. being able to go to all these worlds crafted by the community in either an avatar you made yourself or an avatar the community crafted for public use is an experience. that alone about this game has resurfaced my love for 3d modeling. before this game i had no idea howto use blender or unity but thanks to the community i've learned all this and able to use this for more than just personalizing myself in vrchat. i hope you all can find the time to play this amazing game and make yourself some friends.

I've played this game since closed alpha 2012... and I must say... it's had it's ups and downs.. its a game not fitted for everyone.. but personally... this game's combat and gameplay is just too solid to pass up. it's always kept me coming for more and never lets up with its hype boss fights in the endgame. again.. it's not a game for everyone.. it's VERY hit or miss...I love it for the nice flow of skills when performed right and the combat. pvp also feels somewhat nice, but it's not my cup of tea.. since I am a pve player... if you ever pick up this game.. PLEASE when you hit level 65, try to atleast get to Stormcry +0 and try out your first taste of a simple low leveled hard mode.. you will see the intensity and insanity of the fun in the combat.. you will see yourself improve in survivability when it comes to fights.. it literally teaches you how to play your character to it's fullest and I really like that. you can also get stylish and go ham when the times are optimal and you will see nothing but HUGE numbers of damage on your screen. its something I always loved about MMOs like these. :)

The community is great but the Devs consistently take steps to harm and alienate that community.Sure you can play it and meet some amazing people, but the more you play and get connected in the vrchat community the more you realise how much the Devs hurt that community they originally fostered with updates and terms of service changes that only serve to remove abilities and fun from its fanbase.They say one thing after mass amounts of outrage and then go against what they said months later once a majority forgets about it. They never make promises, they only wait till they can get their original plan across without people realising how it hurts everyone until its too late.

Listen alright, it's not perfect. It isn't the original DayZ from the mods, but I believe they aren't actually going for that. They have created a refined version of the original mod, and made it more realistic along with adding workshop support to allow it to feel more like the original. I feel like other than adding planes and helicopters there isn't much they can do at all. It is definitely fun and enjoyable to play and I 100% feel I will be playing this for many years to come and that is really all I can ask for with a game.

So, after playing through Satsuki's story, I found the game really good. I think the price tag is a bit too high though.Didn't have any bugs or glitches either, game runs with a good framerate, might be even 60 fps, but it's pretty hard to say without having framerates enabled through steam, due to the animation being about 12 frames per second.7/10
Having only around 4 hours in the game at the writing of this review, I have to say, this game is really beautiful.Scenery looks real enough for me to think it's taken from a real place.

I love the art style, I love the music, I love everything about this game, except the controls. Obviously it's just my opinion, but after playing it for 0.3 hours, I got frustrated at the controls. I'll still give it a thumbs up for it being a good game, I just despise the controls.

Beautiful. Just beautiful. I'd tell my opinion on the story now that it's out, but my pc keeps crashing when I play this (Or VR, might be too much for this old machine). But I highly recommend buying this. It's an amazing indie title that everyone should play. And it's fairly cheap too.I highly suggest for you to buy this masterpiece.

If you're thinking about buying this game as your first ever 3D fighter, don't even touch the multiplayer until you've learned combos or such. Everyone who plays multiplayer seem to have too much time on their hands, but still seem like they just want to win for winning. Doesn't matter if you play on manual or normal, ranked and unranked is awfully unbalanced, due to the lack of players and actual consideration for a fair fight. You either fight a champion whose played the game since it was released and lost his job because of it, or someone new spamming the square. It would be so much better, if the devs made so that your opponents would be atleast close to the level of skill you are instead of picking the fighter whose ready right at that moment. And let's not talk about how furiating the multiplayer bug was on launch.The game does have some good qualities of course. The game has great controls, graphics and all together mood. It feels like a fighting game when you actually fight. Customization could be better and have more options, but eh, that's just a minimal problem I have.I hope more people would buy this on pc and actually play it. The peak player count at the moment of me writing this is 1243, With current players being only 89. So if you buy this and decide to play the multiplayer right away, be prepared for alot of unfair matches, especially if you're new. And I'd say wait for a sale on the game. 60$ is alot of money and for a game like this, it's too much.TLDR; Be ready to get your ass kicked in this okay My Hero Academia fighting game.

I love this game and after putting in nearly 1000 hours I'm still having fun! I thought I'd get bored of robbing banks after like 200 hours, but since they keep adding content quite frequently, it has been interesting. You start by robbing a small bank and move to the big scores. And the game is what? 40‚Ç? You get so much content with such a low price compared to most AAA titles. I'm glad Overkill keeps updating the game until the end of 2018 (Atleast from what I've heard).But everything good has something bad in them, so I'll be listing some pros and cons.Pros:-Fairly cheap-Multiple difficulties so new players can get the hang of it-Customizable masks-Weapons, oh the wonderful weapons!-New content added quite often-Alot of heistsCons:-Crashes quite often compared to other games-Those who bought the DLC before it was packed in the Ultimate Edition lose alot of money-Few bugs here and there, nothing critical though-Some heists are repetive and awfully long in some situationsSo, I thought of something Overkill could add to the gameMask Workshop:Let the community create masks for the gameOver all, Payday 2 is a 8/10 in my opinion. If you're feeling like you could rob some banks, cook meth, take down rats, help your old friend out of jail or anything that could be considered a crime, then Payday 2 is the game for you.

The absolute coolest and most creative horror game i have ever played. Hands down. Imagine a combo of IMSCARED (but good) and No Players Online's ARG segment. It's the best of both worlds with a confusing, yet pretty neat story. The weird PS1 styled models are a bit uncanny, adding even more onto the weird and unsettling nature. You'll have to do a lot and a LOT of digging everywhere on the internet and in your computer, (almost) none of them unclear, and all of them being of jaw dropping surprise. Almost 9 hours later and i've gotten every achievement in the game  (one of them i had to use SteamAchievementManager because the dev locked one if you did something else, it was an intentional lock)  , mostly due to having to do precise different choices. I recommend it heavily.

Citystate - A reviewI generally don‚Äôt write reviews, especially not long ones, but I really enjoy this game and wish to see it and it‚Äôs community grow. Here goes:A fun not to complicated city builder that has put large focus on the political aspects of a state. While the main focus seems to be to build the city I would say it is to manage the state that is the main focus, taxes, legislation, budget, and migration policies will be the hardest part of the game to manage until you reach the endgame. Reaching the endgame (having answered all the political issues) will have most likely left you with a stable state. Some cons with this game, although the graphics are oldschool and somewhat simple, the mechanics should not be, the lack of shortcut keys make this essentially a game you play with just your mouse the only keyboard shortcuts you are given that matter somewhat are pause and resume (which both are bound to spacebar).  (I have been informed that the dev is aware of this and will I will amend this part of the review when this is addressed.) Takes a lot of tries to get the hang of it, there is no ‚Äúright way to structure your state and essentially every ideology and combination of policies would make a functioning state, although the game clearly has a prefered way of being played, a Capitalist Democracy seems at least according to my experiences to be the most stable form of governance. As it allows for a stable lower, middle and higher class growth. I would personally recommend  communist states for first timers as you avoid riots and can tax the ever living sh*t out of the lower class, but you will have large financial troubles in the beginning so use the bonds frequently.  The tutorial is not much help at all so I would recommend finding some Youtube tutorials if you can‚Äôt make your city work no matter what. I personally enjoy the process of slowly learning the mechanics and developing the most efficient way to structure my city, but it‚Äôs understandable if not everyone enjoys failing time after time. Look up ‚ÄúAndrewDangerously‚Ä?on Youtube for a decent beginner tutorial. Let‚Äôs look at the pros then, The simple graphics are nostalgic and makes for a smooth running game that can be played on essentially anything.It allows for many forms of player fantasy, you can name your city, give it a flag and there are several different ideologies Here is a quote from the games own website : ‚ÄúThe type of government is made of two words:‚Ä?An adjective that depends on the state‚Äôs Freedom score, 5 possibilities: Libertarian, Capitalist, Liberal, Socialist, Communist‚Ä?A noun related to the state‚Äôs Civil Rights score, 6 possibilities: People‚Äôs Republic, Welfare State, Democracy, Oligarchy, Dictatorship (low freedom score) or Anarchy (high freedom score).‚ÄùI would say these are somewhat biased and oversimplified, but that is to be expected from a game simulating politics, I am confident the dev did his best in this regard, and no matter who did the classifications, someone would feel they are misrepresenting or biased. The game has a simulated refugee system where people will either come to your country if the living standards are good, and you will have to accomodate for this, or people will leave your country if the living standards are horrible. You can either welcome the refugees or build walls and armies to stop them from coming in. There is even an option for space travel and you can build colonies in space, this gamemode is very similar to the one on earth but simplified a lot, it was included in a free update after the games release and that is very much appreciated since it is fun to sometimes check on your space colonies after you have developed your city. (The game is finished according to the dev since he is now working on Citystate II, so there will be no more major updates)There is kinda of a campaign mode, the region screen give your a large empty island that allows for 20 city states to be made on and you are given a map view of all the cities in the menu screen of this game mode, which allows you to marvel at your creations (or failures). All in all, I personally enjoy this game a lot and I have always been fascinated by city states myself so it presses the right buttons. If you enjoy a more relaxed and simplified city builder that focuses more on the state part than the city part, and enjoy the fantasy that this game offers I think you will find the price of 13.90‚Ç?to be a steal because this game can offer hours of fun once you get used to it.

Like.... It's a good game if you're into the Metro formula. I certainly enjoyed my first blind run through.Now, the trouble I have with this game is bugs and crashes. There are cosmetic type bugs that happen all the time that I'm not too concerned about; for some reason the NPCs in my game love to talk over each other during cut scenes, I don't get it but whatever... The crashes to desktop and even worse, hard crashes that force me to restart my PC are what really get me. I was playing on the weekend and the game crashed twice in an hour of play. That's not reasonable.When I played through the first time I didn't have much issue with it because of quick save and auto save. I rarely lost more than 3-4 minutes of my time. The problem now is that I'm playing on Iron Mode in which there are no saves except between map changes. When I got to Volga I lost around half an hour of progress to a crash. I quit for the day. Today playing the same map, I got an hour and a half into the level and got a game breaking bug; I went to use a lever, an enemy came up and hit me during the animation and then my view was stuck pointing down, my mouse was rendered useless but I could move. I could not fight back and died. What a piss off. At this point I had already downgraded to DX11 because it had been suggested in various threads on the internet for people experiencing frequent crashes. So in the end, it's a fun game with an enjoyable story, maybe others will have better luck with stability. If you like to 100% games though, this game may piss you off like it has done to me.*Edit*It's pissed me off enough now that I can't keep the thumb up. I got to the last 30 seconds of a map and it crashed (after having crashed twice before on the same map much earlier). I have repeatedly lost hours on every map now because of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• stability. If you play this game, never do Iron Mode.

Crash? Crash crash, crash crash crash. Been on the same quest for the last 2 days. Don't buy until fixes come out and prices go down.*Edit*Came back a few years later because I did actually want to try this game out once it was more stable. A few minutes into it and I find myself getting stuck at terminals randomly. Look it up... Oh great, this is because of my 144Hz refresh rate, which isn't anything over the top and new age. So I have to lock the frames at 60fps in order to play properly, but of course there isn't an option for that in game or the config files so now I have to download a 3rd party program in order to lock the fps. Still thumbs down, I don't like having to jump through hoops to play a modern game on my modern PC.Accidentally forgot to run my 3rd part program and had my fps at their natural state, noticed that the loading screens take half as long when my fps isn't forcibly limited... FFSAFK for 10 minutes, my Windows decides to turn off the screen despite the game running. Return to find a black screen that I can't exit. All the standard stuff doesn't work, can't get task manager to show or anything. Have to press my power button on my tower. After a couple of minutes of wild flickering, the game finally closes as my PC is about to shut off. The struggle of this game.... I just want to get SOME enjoyment out of the $70 I paid.Still get random crashes to desktop with no error screen while just walking around.

I wish this port didn't suck, but it does. Bad frame rate drops even with graphics settings turned down. I turned AA off completely and the game ran at 8 FPS.  Turned back on I get between 45-60 depending on what's going on around me, but despite the reported FPS, I get constant drops which make it painful to play, even indoors. This is with an OC'ed GTX970 and a seperate SSD for my Steam games. These problems have been reported since its release with no feedback for fix. I've stopped playing.*July 8, 2015 Update*Congrats R*, you fixed something. With mostly maxed out settings I now get 60+ FPS indicated and experienced. Even the choppiness I get in the menu is gone. I have resumed playing.

tl;dr ChilloutVR is now vastly superior in every respect.VRChat plans to add Easy Anti Cheat in the next update. What will it do for the game? Well let me show you:What EAC will do for VRChat:Lower frameratesIncrease instabilityStop script kiddiesStop "wholesome" mods, accessibility mods, and quality of life modsStop AMD FSR/RSR, Intel XeSS, Nvidia VRWorks SLI from improving your framerateStop select SteamVR mods that modify the game's runtimeStop programs like AudioTeapot (audio manager/soundboard) from workingStop Linux users from playing via proton (they claimed it wouldn't yet it does)Stop Linux users from playing via Windows virtual machinesLower the playerbaseWhat EAC will NOT do for VRChat:Stop ripping (Avatar cache is still unprotected)Stop crashing (Crasher avatars)Stop all malicious mods (Those devs see this as a programming challenge)Stop all malicious actors (There's other ways of being annoying)Stop SDK moddingStop user harassment (Stop claiming this!)Close the security holes in VRC UdonImprove the game experienceWhat EAC has done in the present/past:Take routine snapshots of the user's desktop/video bufferScan all processes running on user's machinesKill or try to kill all "unknown" or "untrusted" or "unregistered" running processes (including homemade processes)Locate the files of "unknown" or "untrusted" or "unregistered" processes and upload them to Epic's serversScan the user's C:\Users\ folder and appdata folderStop users from launching the game if Windows fails to install/update itself "correctly" (google "easyanticheat UNEXPECTED-KERNEL-MODE-TRAP", though epic tries to censor this issue)Stop device drivers that are "unknown" or "untrusted" or "unregistered" from running (including homemade drivers)VRChat devs, I know you don't care because you're hiding all the complaint posts on the feedback canny and ignore everyone's requests to just add the QoL mod ideas into the game, but for the love of god don't add EAC and listen to your community's requests. It is not good for the innocent users, the "wholesome" modders, and the QoL modders. Don't get me wrong, I love the community and opportunities this game has provided to me, but this is just an awful move from the devs, even with me not caring for client mods. Also maybe consider change whoever is writing the blog posts, they're so super tone deaf.

This is a revised review and I'm gonna keep it brief. The game is unoptimized as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and even after turning off the high res textures in the game's properties setting on Steam, I still have crashes occurring on my machine. That said, the challenge system is terrible. Some weapons are nearly impossible to get kills with. I also want to be able to choose which game modes I play instead of playing playlist roulette. Aside from that, the gameplay is fun and engaging, like Reach or Halo 3 was on the 360. It might not be as amazing as Halo 2, but maybe someday they'll put in the old maps and more game modes.
I rate my games based on play time per dollar spent. I spent zero on this. This means the game is okay.

Somehow, Newgrounds keeps finding ways to show its relevance to the internet. This game is sick and you should play it, whether or not you're familiar with Madness. However, you'll enjoy it a lot more if you are.

How to play Mad Max immersively.1. Don't drink water today.2. Turn off your AC (skip this step if you live in the UK)3. Put on a leather jacket4. Roll around in the dirt5. Pretend to be Australian6. Spill gasoline in your room (the smell will make the game more immersive)If you followed any of these steps, you're actually dumb. The game's alright if you don't mind a post apocalyptic take on the most popular third person games of the 2010's. Batman combat, empty-ish open world, repetitive side quests, but the car combat is fun. Every vehicle sucks compared to the Magnum Opus, including the Imperator though. The real meat of the game comes in the form of raiding bases, messing up convoys, and racing. The story is sub par and doesn't really follow the Mad Max formula. Instead of Max serving as a vessel looking into the world of Australia five years from now, the story is focused on him getting his car back. Sure, there's sub-plots in the game, but honestly, I was half-tempted to skip the cutscenes half the time because some aspects of the story became grating. The game's still fun though, and if you see it on sale for fifteen bucks or less, then it's worth the price of admission.

A long time ago the guy behind Skulltag wanted to break out on his own to make his own game and this is what we got. While the art style was neat, I felt like the movement wasn't crisp and the level design was heavily lacking. Not only that, but the weapons didn't feel too great to use. I'm surprised this game even got finished. Chances are, had CarnEvil waited a few more years to start working on this game and time it with the whole boomer shooter trend, it wouldn't have done too badly and I'm sure this game would have been much higher quality than it is in its current state. If you want to buy a boomer shooter, choose anything else but this.

I feel like the AI is incredibly flawed and it ruins the overall experience, especially since their routing and slow movement speed really makes getting through narrow hallways a pain, but chances are the types of people who play these games won't care. If it weren't for the immersion breaking AI I would consider this a horror classic.
A horror classic and THE walking simulator.

I played this game on Game Pass, so think of this review as from someone who's beaten the game and has about 85% completion.This is a prime example of a good game. The graphics are beautiful, the music is wonderful, the gameplay is near flawless, the levels are expansive and well designed, and while its replay value isn't as strong as I'd like it to be, it's only because I want to experience this game for the first time again. This is unquestionably a modern classic. More importantly, the story and the setting captivated me in a way that no other game has in many, many years. I want to make this a brief review so I can say that you're doing yourself a disservice by not playing this game, but I'd recommend playing through Blind Forest first if you haven't already.To compare how highly I think of this game, it's better than anything that came out in 2020, it's better than something like Symphony of the Night or Super Metroid, and it's better than most games in general. I would unironically put this game in my top five favorite games of all time. On a scale of one out of ten, it would be a 9.25, nearly a perfect game. The only improvements I would make is a better quest system and a randomizer mode for better replayability. It's well worth the 30 dollars, but it goes on sale for 15, so buy it then.
