Marinate the chicken: Combine the 2 teaspoons soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil in a small bowl. Add the sliced chicken, and toss to completely coat. Set aside while you cook the noodles.Cook the chow mein noodles according to package directions, drain well, and set aside.Heat half of the oil (1 tablespoon) in a very large skillet or wok. When is is very hot, but not smoking, add the chicken mixture, and stir fry until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken to a plate, set aside and keep warm.Add the rest of the oil to the skillet, then add the cabbage, bok choy, water chestnuts and garlic; stir fry for a couple of minutes until the vegetables begin to wilt. Add the noodles, and continue to cook until the noodles are hot, and well combined with the vegetables.Add the soy sauce and oyster sauce, toss to combine. Add the chicken, toss to combine.Transfer the chow mein to a serving platter, and top with the chopped green onions. Serve immediately.

Saw this amazing Pie Recipe and thought I should share it!Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing

A simple and great Ginger beef recipe.Place cornstarch in a large bowl.Add water gradually while whisking.Beat eggs into cornstarch mixture.Toss in beef and stir to coat.Pour 1 inch of oil into wok, heat until boiling hot, but not smoking.Add a quarter of the beef to the oil.Seperate with a fork and cook, stirring frequently, until crispy, Remove, drain on paper towel and set aside.Repeat until all the beef is cooked.Drain off all oil except for about 1 tablespoons and add carrots, onion, ginger, and garlic in that order.Stir fry briefly over high heat.Combine last 5 ingredients and add to vegetable mixture.Bring to a boil and then add beef.Heat thorough and serve immediately.

FM 2016 was stupidly difficult. Tactics would never work, goalies were bloody useless, defenders acted like muppets, players would get upset if they didn't play 1 match and REBOUNDS!!!!!This year most of this, for me at least, has gone away. Less annoying ass rebounds where the goalie parries it perfectly into the attackers feet, sure they still happen but nowhere near as frequently as in FM 16. Defenders are now somewhat competent and don't miss an absurd amount of headers that result in the opposing striker 1 on 1 with your goalie. I don't have players handing in transfer requests left right and centre because I told our back-up goalie he played ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Oh and now you can tell a defender that he played ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• without hearing the old "We all played ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, don't single me out!" response.Highly recommend this years FM, feels way more polished than last years.

As a fairly new fan of the Phoenix Wright series, I was thinking this game would be a good way to take a break from my playthough of the trilogy. It was something similar, yet it seemed like it would add a new twist to the formula. So I bought the game on the Steam Summer Sale. ...I stopped after case 3. $15 down the drain, and 15 hours of my life I will never get back. So where did it all go wrong?I'm going to assume everyone reading this knows the game's basic concepts, so I'll get right into my thoughts. (the TL:DR version will be at the bottom).For starters, let's talk about the characters. Most of the guys are complete douchebags, and most of the girls are bland waifu material. The only slightly interesting character was Kyoko, and I only talked to the others to get abilities to help me later on. I could barely stand any of them, they all seemed like they came right out of a cheesy slasher film.The friendship mechanic is also pointless. It doesn't change anything about the game, and to actually talk to the characters you want to talk to, you have to run all over the school like a chicken with your head cut off, trying to find them, while going through the room transistions that always waste your time. It's not fun or fulfilling in the slightest, I don't even want to be friends with most of these people.However, the trials are the meat of this game. So how do they hold up? Not very well either. Each trials is split up into minigames that will easily get on your nerves. I'll talk about each of them individually, but I came up with names for the minigames of my own.-Overly Glorified Cross-Examinations-These are basically where you use "truth bullets", which are basically pieces of evidence. This is basically a worse version of a Phoenix Wright cross-examination, except it points out potential contradictions for you, has a time limit, you can't stay on a single phrase for as long as you need, and you can't go back to a previous statement if you miss your shot. Yes, you actually have to shoot the contradiction. They try throwing in obstacles, but silencers deal with them instantly, so they're pretty much pointless.-Hangman's Exploit-Basically a game of hangman where you need to wait for the letter you want to appear, and then shoot it. Why do I call it Hangman's Exploit? Well, you can pause the game during this time, which pauses the timer, and so gives you all the time you need to think. So basically, the timer is pointless.-Rhythm Heaven Fever: "I Won't Listen to You" Edition-Basically, to get someone who refuses to listen to anything you're saying, you have to play a rhythm game. ...Could the developers not come up with something better than this? It's just frustrating, espeiclaly when it stops you from seeing anything, because I swear the music is not timed correctly to the beat. This game is supposed to be about wit, not being forced to play a rhythm game to proceed. I mean, I'm just going to fire a truth bullet at their last statement anyways, so what's the point of shooting down all their irrelevant statements? Plus, the game clearly says it's a popular vote to decide who the blackened is, so who cares if one person is throwing a hissy fit?-Freaking Comic Assembly-...I hate this minigame. I have a hard time telling what the pictures are supposed to be showing, and I just wish there was a caption on each one, just so I know for sure which one is which. It also throws in comic bits from previous cases to throw you off... which obviously doesn't work.The trials also did not feel satisfying to me, since I just didn't care about the story. All I wanted to do was get though it, and combined with the minigames, it felt like a chore, especially since most of the contradictions required such little thought to spot, even on the hardest difficulty. Not to mention all of the plot holes. ...So many glaring plot holes... it gives me a headache just thinking about all of them... Now, here's a list of some of my other nitpicks.1. Why are the characters talking about their escape plans in a room with a camera?2. Why does it have to take place in a school? It doesn't change anything.3. What's the point of telling me nighttime is at 10 p.m, when there is no way to keep track of time?4. Why does every room need to play a transition everytime I walk inside it?5. Why are Byakuya, Kyoko and I the only competent characters in the entire game?6.  Why are only some lines of dialogue commentated over, and the rest are not or have some genaric line or groan?7. What's with all the swearing? It gets really annoying after a while.8. Why is the layout of the school so confusing? I mean, there seems to be no pattern.9. Why is only access to the dining hall restricted during nighttime?10. Why is the blood pink? It just seems out of place.Overall, Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, is a disappointing game. The fact I couldn't finish it even though I tried to shows it. I wanted to see the end but this game is not worth my time. There's no reason to care about what's going on, the characters are generic, and the gameplay is poor. I don't care about finishing this game at all. Just get the Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Trilogy on the 3DS, it's a series that's actually worth your time.(TL;DR)Gameplay: 3/10Story: 3/10Characters: 2/10Level Design: 4/10Final Score: 3/10 -Bad

The best way to describe Garry's Mod is this. Imagine yourself in a dimension where you can make anything you want from the tools that they give you. You can make an epic battle. How about a home made spaceship. How about a tower? Maybe even a movie. The possibilities are endless. You can even download more stuff from the steam workshop if the basic tools weren't enough for you. You will need a Source Engine game, but if you do, get this game.8/10 GREAT

"This is the story of a man named Stanley..."- Narrator, The Stanley Parable.The Stanley Parable is one of those few games that make you feel scared without needing a monster or constant threat of death. The game has you playing as Stanley, an office worker who finds out that one day, all of his co-workers are gone. But the game is not just about Stanley, it's about the narrator too, and he can be really creepy. I'm not telling you how, you must play it for yourself. The game has 18 endings and all of these are reached by deciding where to go. The game also has subliminal messages, like that every door that locks behind you, in a way represents that when you make a decision, there is no going back, unless you restart the game. In fact, the game automatically starts over when you get an ending, with the message "the end is never" on the loading screen. So if you want to play this game, go right ahead. Just be warned, prepare yourself for some of the ways the game messes with your mind.

Planetside 2 ruined my life. It has hypnotized me to keep playing this game.1/10 RUN FOR YOUR LIFE!...Nah, just kidding. Time for the real review. After the abismal 8BitMMO, I needed a new MMO to satisy my online multiplayer needs. I was thinking about getting this game before, but now I have it, and what do I think? Keep reading to find out. Planetside 2 is a sci-fi, fps, mmo that has 3 empires (the Terran Republic, New Comglomerate, and Vanu Sovereignty), waging war against each-other on the planet Auraxis. The Terran an the defunked government of the planet, trying to regain control and make contact with Earth again. The New Comglomerate are an empire of rebels that rebelled against the Terran because they want freedom. The Vanu Sovereignty are a group of people who split-off from both empires, to make a cult about alien technology. The 3 empires are in a territorial war in which they take territory from eachother. The game also has 5 classes. The infiltraitor, light assault, combat medic, engineer, and the heavy assault, plus a max suit. All of these have a role in the war, it would take forever to list them all, so let's move on. The factions also have different atributes, the Terrans have larger clip sizes, the Comglomerate have hard hitting weapons/tanks, and the Vanu have lazers, LAZERS! I bet all of you just joined the Vanu because they have lazers. Anyways, the game will require a good machine, so those little kids with the laptops, i'm sorrry, you can't play without getting a very low frames per second. If you machine can run this with everything at it's lowest and with over 10 frames per second, like mine, you might be able to have fun with this game. Just as a warning, you will die a lot at first, so be warrned, you won't be isnsta-pro after you've completed the turtorial. The game is also team based, you will need to join a squad or platoon if you you want to really experience what this game has to offer. You can also get vehicles in this game. You can even rank up by killing people, or helping your team. The graphics are nice, and the sound quality is great. even at very low settings the game looks nice. The colors of the factions are distinct enough so I can see who are my teamates and who are my enemies. The game is an mmo after all, so the battles can get big. There can be explosions everywhere, infantry and tanks on the ground storming or defending a facility, and planes battling overhead. Also, you can buy new weapons and other things with cert points or station cash. It does start to lean a little bit to pay to win, because without membership, the free cert points are a nightmare to get, and the station cash is the pay currency, and yu might have to pay real money to gt the weapon you want, but with membership, cert points are easier to acquire, and you get station cash every month. The game also has things like hit Q while you looking at an enemy, and it gets a little target thing above it.The game has no AI, which is nice, and is FREE TO PLAY. So if you want it, you can get it right now. You can even join a little outfit, which is like a group. Overall, Planetside 2 is a great mmo, it keeps you playing and makes you want more. I give it an 8/10 GREAT

Don't Starve is a survival sandbox that has a ton of exploration. You go around the randomly generating world, collecting resources to make fires, tools, and many other things. You also have to collect food, it should be obvious from the game's title.Also, don't think you'll be fine without a campfire for the night, you will die. Also, don't rush into a herd of enemies without weapons or armor, its stupid and you will die if you don't immediately run away.  The game looks great with its cel shaded graphics, and the atmosphere is creepy and mysterious. It also rewards exploration with cool discoveries, which I won't spoil. I also like the game's soundtrack, it really adds a lot of atmosphere to this already great game. It also has that sense of dread, but also the sense of the unknown. The game's sound is unique and interesting, an example is when your character is hit, he/she makes a weird lower pitched squeak noise. Also, if you die, you start over. Overall, I recommened this game to anyone who likes survival and exploration games. Its worth every penny, and it keeps you coming back for more. If you do get it, I would recommend reading some guides, it will help you in the long run. Thats all I have to say.I give it a 9/10 AMAZING

RISK Factions is a multiplayer war strategy game with a singleplayer campaign. The game is about the five factions. Humans, cats, robots, zombies, and yetis. The game is quirky and includes the classic RISK game. This is a really great game. I recommend it to anyone into strategy.

This game is anything but anything bad. This game is everything good. It is hard, it is challenging, it is amazing. You control a three man team on a mission to deliver important information to thier base. Its not that simple though, as the rebels hunt you down. If you stay in a sector too long, they might catch up to you! Every sector may contain enemies, shops, distress signals, or even a nebula. (protip: nebulas are evil!) The game also randomly generates, so you will have a different adventure evey time. Watch out though, if you die, you need to start over. To add insult to injury, the game is hard. It is not punishing though becuase its a short game, maybe about an hour or so. Also, the sectors can contain different creatures, some may join your crew! Can you accomplish this daunting task, or will you be the next cluster of space junk?

A game that makes the impossible, possible, thanks to the portal gun. In this game, you use the portal gun to create portals you can go through. The game puts you in Apeture Science, a research facility that has test subjects test the dea... uh, I mean perfectly safe inventions. The game has some basic puzzels at first, but then you get the portal gun. When you get it, the game starts to become harder, until you reach the end... or is it? This is a great puzzel game that will make you think with portals.

It's like a giant inside joke about FPS games on PC. How much you understand depends on how many FPS games you've played. Even if you don't get it the jokes, this is still a fun boomer shooter.

Fun game, so far it has a few issues but nothing that kills the game out right. Some players are saying they are having low fps but I'm not having that issue but fps can be all over the place so I would turn down / off shadows.  Nothing seems broken or over powered so far and the maps seem alright for the most part. There is no three lane BS going on in the game thankfully. Has a counter strike style buy menu but you buy (with in match money) perks, kill streaks, and equipment (things like nades and flashes). You do have classes based off the type of weapon you want to use- rifle, sniper, smg, etc. Customizing your guns is the same as any other modern shooter. The loot boxes in this are not a big deal you can't buy them with real money or GP as of typing this, you only unlock them via ranking up and doing contracts. The tasks from contracts are doing things like get 25 head shots or something like that. The loot boxes end up acting more like a way to randomly unlock something that you can unlock just by playing. Most the time I already had the thing unlocked before I got it in the loot box. All in all if you like shooters give it a try, it's fun for the most part. The game even has it's fair share of kids calling everyone that kills them a hacker- so go nutz.

I have almost 8 hours at the time of writing this, a lot of people have 1-4 and are saying its crap without even taking the proper time to play the game, "AI is bad, its bland blah blah blah" So far, I have taken my time. Only made it to Act 2 stage 2 in 8 hours. So far I have found it actually really enjoyable from the normal ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• being thrown around right now good breath of fresh air if you will. Wont go into a long story below you can see a Pros/ cons i have found so far.Pros.-Good challenge, they have a recommended power level for each "difficulty" setting there is if you have a 1400 power-score and try to jump to the hardest.... yeah you're gonna get ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• what did you think? -Dialogue, Fun banter between the characters and even the Goblins will say some funny as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• if you pause and listen to them talk rather then rushing and killing them. -Dope cut scenes, Without spoilers. At the start of act 1 and 2 and the ending of act 1 there are some good cut scenes that look very nice. which adds some touch of story to this hack n slash.Ability's/feats/what not- The ability's look amazing, each character has something to them that just makes you smile if that's launching a goblin 10 feet in the air and splat to shooting a wave of arrows and watching them die, each has their own little fun bits that makes you go "hahahha dumb goblin ded."Story- This is a hack and slash, the amount of story and lore they put into it is by far enough in my opinion. There's a good run up to who and what each character is with some lore you can read and at the start of each act if you take more then 30 seconds to listen gives you a over view of the level and whats going on. Its honestly, not as bad as others of stated.Mixed.Combat- This is going to be a mix for me, don't get me wrong its leaning more on the Pros side. But, there are times you're trying to MX11 a goblin but your move just inst registering and you're only doing a heavy or a light and its just not doing that amazing combo. Granted that could be im just not used to Combo style games and im stupid which is likely but Its a Frustrating thing time to time. But most of the time combat seems fluid and fun for me and 2 friends(forgot to add this. On occasion we have noticed if you have a lot of knock up ability's it dose not know what to do and will just throw the Goblin down at a random location that it seems fit.)Cons.Traps- in act 1 there are ice spikes here and there that you need the effect of "Warm" to avoid. Around where the sub boss guy is for the side quest while on the ladder over the spikes you normally run out of this effect and even when off the spikes you take damage but sometimes you don't? its Weird, but is none the less posting cringe.World- While the game looks and runs amazingly there are times where in the middle of combat or you're running around you'll clip into a door and be stuck or clip into a Goblin and get just minced, while each time i have been able to get out before i punch a hole in my monitor still aggravating at times. Glitches- Sometimes on a full team death you get infinite loading where you're "in the game" but stuck with the screen itself, can still move attack and be killed but cant see anything.Thats really all i have experienced so far ill add more as i play. Have been enjoying it a lot thus far and it is first or er second day of release now so im sure the two cons i listed will be touched up soon enough.

Early quicky speedy review.Pros: -A new Melty Blood game!-Great visuals-Contains some voice lines and character moves from previous Melty Blood games-New special moves (moon something idk they're cool)-Networking mode is great, love playing online! :DCons: -A lil pricey for the amount of content you get at launch. (May change)-Auto combo auto combo auto combo auto combo auto combo (please change)Summary: If you liked making your own combos in MBAACC this game will not let you have that freedom. 90% of your attacks will be auto-combos. If you're new to fighting games and don't know how to string combos, aerials and what not, this game is a great start. For more experienced players who love that crescent moon style MBAACC gameplay, this is fairly different. The game holds your hands for all your combos, it gets frustrating since all you need to do is hit one button to do a combo. Yeah you can do your specials but they're not your combos, they're your specials. Give the game a go, if you like it; keep it. If not; refund it.

If you really want to know if you like this game, you need to play it. It's such a unique experience that the reviews, gameplays, streams, etc can not reciprocate. It's an "imperfect perfection".It's also buggy as f*ck.Edit: After more time with this game and more glitches and bugs. In it's current state Cyberpunk 2077 is raw, like a uncut natural diamond. It's not shiny or glitzy and glamorous. It's going to need work and it'll take time. It has infinite potential though. Don't listen to a negative review that bashes on the game for it's poor FPS/Optimization. That'll get ironed out and fixed. You need to focus on what's ahead for this game. CDPR has supported The Witcher 3 for five years now. A card game, a T.V Series, multiple DLCs/Expansions on top of it's long campaign. Cyberpunk is in good hands, I believe CDPR will work on this game for years. They've spent 8 on it just developing it, why drop it now? If I were you I'd wait on buying, unless you have a 3060 ti+, you're most likely going to get FPS under 60. Just sit tight, the game isn't going anywhere.And remember: A rocky start can't determine a fantastic finish.

If you already own the game, that sucks for you, and if you don't, either wait for a heavy sale, or don't buy it at all.The actual worst (or close to it) game in this series. Missions either restart you from the very start, or from before you even started the mission with very few of them actually having decent checkpoints.Difficulty is completely artificial, and even winning in the harder modes doesn't feel good.Anyone still recommending this game is delusional, or too die hard of a fan to take their word seriously.You MUST play this game with friends since the AI is always in bad positions and can pick you up once PER fight, which is fine and dandy, but when fights last either half a second or days, really depends where you're at.Have fun doing the same missions over and over again, with some of them making zero sense, like Operation Watchman, where you must completely sneak and can't kill a soul or even be spotted, and then the next objective is to let that ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• loose and kill anyone who is nearby or comes over without a care in the world.But hey, at least it isn't Breakpoint.Allowing comments so people can complain and be wrong.

Think of a mix between Hunt: Showdown, and Escape from Tarkov, but doesn't know how to make itself unique in it's own way.Should you play? Sure, it's F2P, but if you don't like those kind of games already, then you probably wont like this one.Movement in the game too is iffy, while it's nice to climb things, the game can't decide whats too tall to climb, and when you can actually do it, especially if you try to make a leap for a close ledge.There's a lot of potential in it, but they need to figure out it's movement system, as well as how monsters detect you since they also don't seem to know when they can see you and when they cant.All in all, it isnt terrible, will hold you over if you need a break from similar games or are waiting for the Tarkov wipe like I am.

Absolutely wonderful Minesweeper-like, great quality of life features and general experience. If you enjoyed the Hexcells series, this is a must.

The game's reasonably fun, and for $3 it's certainly a good value. I didn't enjoy this nearly as much as the other "-Cells" games from the same developer, which is a shame, but that's not particularly an issue with this one; it's just that HexCells and SquareCells set the bar ridiculously high. If you loved the others, it's worth playing this one. If you haven't played the others, they're much easier to recommend and overall feel better to play.

2020 has been a big year for roguelites, and Hades is one of the stars of the show - the game is just really, really good. The  gameplay is tons of fun, the progression is satisfying, and it's oozing with the style that I've come to expect from Supergiant. It's not the most innovative game out there, but the level of polish is absolutely off the charts, and playing it is really a treat.

The post-apocalyptic deliveryman gameplay is very fun, and it has the signature Kojima weirdness without it being overpowering. It's a very distinct taste, but it's exactly what I expected and hoped for when I bought the game, and I'm not disappointed in the least.

Getting Over It is almost a religious experience. The commentary on the way up is thought-provoking, and helps keep your mind off the repetitive tasks. The climbing itself is brutally difficult, but it's so rewarding when you finally progress. I consider myself fairly good at video games, but the relatively short time I spent with Getting Over It felt like one of my greatest accomplishments when I finally "got over it" and climbed the mountain. It's a relatively simple game, but it's the type of game that sticks with you. For that, at least, it's an experience I recommend.

Winter Polaris starts slow, but it has masterful storytelling and explores interesting themes and ideas. If you liked previous stage-nana works, this is an excellent followup to Rain Marginal or Narcissu. If not, you might be better suited trying the others first; they're a bit more approachable, and also excellent.

Slay the Spire is an absolutely excellent game for roguelite fans; it masters the standard roguelite fare of a sense of improvement with continued play, a tense atmosphere with the risk of losing your run to a mistake at any time, and the continuous questions of risk vs. reward. The card-based gameplay is a nice touch, and works extremely well; it complements the roguelite elements perfectly, and feels reminiscent of more traditional card games yet unique. I have no complaints; this is a must-have for roguelite fans.

Stellaris is a fun twist on the usual Paradox formula, and as such has many of the faults and virtues you could expect to find in any PDS grand strategy game. Where it stands out is its fantastic setting and use thereof; while expanding and generally improving your empire in its contemporaries is most usually a process of nearly constant war, the vast emptiness of the galaxy in Stellaris makes more or less pacifist play actually viable, and rather fun. The setting also lends itself to roleplay very well, and is full of references to many sci-fi and space opera properties. If any of this sounds fun to you, Stellaris might be a game for you.

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

UhNot too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes insteadIngredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

My first run took over 11 hours. The second time lasted nearly 2, but by the time I had achieved every achievement and beaten the game 50 times and was awarded a golden bucket, my time was almost down to 5 minutes. I was had overcome the pain that Bennett Foddy wanted me to feel and I felt unstoppable.Then I realized I was addicted to Bennett Foddy's voice, and it was beautiful.
This game runs like a steaming hot pile of garbage. Even on the lowest settings possible this game doesn't break 35fps with a Ryzen 7 2700X and RX 480. Entirely unplayable.

There's nothing I could say here that others haven't already. From head to toe (and this is one tall game) this game is quite literally flawless. You will lose your soul to this game, but every second of it is worth it; and the only reason I have so few hours is because I played a lot off of Steam.

I gotta say, while this game was short, I still enjoyed it quite a bit. Honestly, there's not much that I can say that other people haven't already.  What Remains of Edith Finch shows you through a sketchy, towering house that's generations old and packed with stories about the lives of the Finches. It's an emotional story, and I think you would learn that the best by through playing the game. Technologically, this game is sound. It runs well and looks quite good throughout the various unique art styles and perspectives that were taken on. Additionally, the audio as a whole was pleasant, to say the least, and the voice acting was superb and immersive. To finalize this, I recommend if you're on the edge of purchasing What Remains of Edith Finch, you go ahead do it for an enjoyable narrative tale.

Ori and the Blind Forest: Definitive Edition, a seriously mind-blowing, atmospheric and beautiful game... that's if you can even call it a game. Ori wasn't developed like other games are, it was carefully crafted with immense detail and a soundtrack that gracefully (or not so gracefully) moves you through the story like a film. There are quality and unique gameplay mechanics throughout the entirety of the game. I left Ori and the Blind Forest on my wishlist for over 2 years before finally picking it up, and I regret not purchasing it sooner. If you're on the border of buying Ori and the Blind Forest, let my review and the 10,000 other positive reviews (that say the same things I tried to but couldn't) persuade you into making an unforgettably great choice.

This game is by far one of the most challenging yet fun and satisfying games I have played in a long time. The 30's art style is beyond amazing, the soundtrack is just as perfect, and overall you can very well see how much thought and effort was put into making this outstanding game by StudioMDHR. That's a decent summary to keep it short.If you're like me and playing Cuphead with a keyboard and mouse by preference (or don't have a controller), you're definitely going to want to remap your controls. Here's what I've found works best for me if you want to give that a shot:Move Right: DMove Left: AMove Up: WMove Down: SJump: Up ArrowShoot: SpaceEx Shoot: Down ArrowSwitch Weapon: TabLock: Left ControlDash: Left ShiftNow go get em!
When the servers aren't empty this game is fun to mess around in. Unique, easy to pick up, and runs well.

Airscape: The Fall of Gravity is a very challenging platformer that lets you dip your feet in the water and then shoves you into the deep end. It's pretty much guaranteed you'll struggle but it's a lot of fun when you have nothing better to do. The level design is great; forcing skill and observation from you, and the octopi are irresistibly cute. This game deserves to be bought and at least tried even if you're new to platformers like me. I can see myself playing this on rainy days in the future if I'm bored enough to pick up something I haven't in a long time.

I paid 49 cents for this game knowing it was going to be horrid, anyone expecting more shouldn't be here. Got achievements and cards, that's all I can ask for. It was also a pretty good meme and maybe even fun for a little bit, I'd recommend it.

Grand Theft Auto V, a single and multiplayer game deep at the core with many hours of gameplay, seriously is a good game and worth picking up if you can get it on sale for $30 or less. The story is fun and the game is balanced and rather optimized. However, there are some things I, and others, don't like:GTA: Online is the very definition of toxic and isn't worth the pay-to-win grind unless you dream of bullying newcomers in the future. You will be killed repeatedly until you figure out how to do it to others. To make any reasonable amount of money you need a squad or you'll be left in the dirt, mind you, everything costs money in GTA. The rest of this isn't for Online though; personally, I think GTA 5 is unenjoyable without mods. Back in June, Take-Two Interactive sent a Cease and Desist letter to the team behind OpenIV, a modding software for GTA, with the hopes that it would severely slow modders from messing with Online. They have since taken it back, but the scar will remain; hence my negative review.

This Is The Police meets Rainbow 6 Siege meets XCOM... It's a super fun side game for XCOM veterans, and a new experience for any strategy fan.I've read a lot of the negative reviews and most of them stem from the fact that people were looking for XCOM 3. This is a $20 game, this is not XCOM 3. Hell, War Of The Chosen was $40 and that was just a DLC, so this game is brilliant for the price it's at.Others had problems that the characters lacked good personalities. I disagree with this point. I enjoy the light, humorous, MCU-esque vibe that the characters give off and once you dig into the game, the interactions the characters have range anywhere from sad and emotional to mocking the XCOM franchise.The third biggest criticism chain (sadly) is that some people think it's SJW propaganda... because there's "aliens" I guess? And there is species discrimination? If anything the game is anti-racist (which is debatable because species vs race) so are they saying they are racist? Idk, it's some ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, if you're a rational human being you'll ignore those blockheads. The worst part of this game to me is the lack of customization. Obviously you can't create troops but even the guns can't be visually modified and you can only change the color of armor. Maybe it will be something they add in the future or something a mod can fix, but it doesn't really subtract from the core of the game.I purchased the game for $10 when it was on sale and easily my favorite $10 or below game, maybe even $25 or below. 10/10 for price to content ratio, 8/10 just solely on content. Give it a try next sale if you are unsure, but if you like XCOM, it is not much different.

Here's a truthful review... no biases (until the end)For Honor has an in-depth fighting system that is unlike any before. The immersion to this combat can be very fun, but also very stressful which could be the reason why some people don't like it. The learning curve, especially as the game gets older, is super high and some new comers don't understand that going into a 4v4 player vs player match as your first game will not end well. The servers are buggy, but on good wifi, crashes only occur 1-3 times per 50 sessions (doesn't crash the whole game, just the match). Character balance, while not perfect, is being improved by the devs, and as a player gets more skilled, these unbalances go away. The community can be cancerous, but most times it's either funny or they are bad and you can mine salt from them. Vortexes are a major problem, especially in duels (vortxes are infinite attack chains). The devs have made little acknowledgement to this issue, but they are involved in their community on reddit, so the fix may come eventually.Bias:If you like medeival combat, get the game. Even if you absolutely can't handle multiplayer for some reason, the campaign has a pretty solid story and is a challenge to new players (and realistic mode is a challenge to all players). I don't see how anyone could not get some fun out of this game. Server issues are being exaggerated by a handful of players, and character balance is being exaggerated by new, salty, or bad players.

Notice how the people who say the game is pay to win have like 10 or less hours. People, it takes time to make perfect builds and understand the functions and metas. If you've ever played any competitive game you'd know that. In game purchases do speed up the process of building a great deck, but it's not a big deal tbh. And trust me, I complain about pay-to-win like a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô? If you have a mind for strategy, you can make it as far as you want, even past the abyssian ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?and the people dropping bucks on this game. And it's a free game with a small download size, there's no risk in picking up this game, other than the fact that you'll probably spend way too many hours on it.

After Season 1 left my heart shattered, I got right on to Season 2. While Season 1 was an amazing joyride of action and drama, Season 2 is the same joyride, but on steroids. Each episode gives you hope, tears it back down, and then makes you forget "hope" ever had a meaning. Review with spoilers:Episode 1 ended a little sloppier then the other episodes, but the action made up for it...in my game, you fight bandits, walkers, a dog, and you even have to do a little 007 around a house.   Where Episode 1 fell short, Episode 2 was there to clean up. You get to know more about the group that saved you, including their flaws, their strengths, and their worries. And despite their being lots of action, the most exciting part was reuniting with Kenny, who was one of the many characters whose death was unknown. Key things that made this episode special were the forshadow, the VERY important desiscions, and of course, the internal conflict with each of the characters.In episode 3, you once again find your charcater jailed up, but since you play as Clementine, you get to do all the risky infiltration to take down Carver's house of nutjob. IF you bought the "400 Days" episode, you will be in awe as you realize where the survivors of that episode end up. Episode 3 may not feel like as much of a roller coaster as the other episodes, but I assure you, the desperation of revenge really makes the episode unqiue. And by far one of the funniest moments was me screaming "CUT THAT ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?S ARM OFF," as I attempt to save Kenny's girlfriend, only to have her die immedietly. Episode 4 is a mostly feel good episode after the rescue. Jokes are made, "good times" are had between survivors, and Alvin Jr is born... All this feel good only to have to make one of the hardest desiscions of the game. And last, but certainly not least, Episode 5, the episode that always ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?you up. It starts off with an intense gunfight, but the episode progresses to where the main threat for the survivors is the mental state of Kenny. If you are evn 50% attached to any character after the lake incident, you're gonna get ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, because I guarentee you'll hate everyone by the end of the episode (except maybe Kenny). The only thing I can complain about is there not being an option to shoot Jane once Kenny dies and the baby is found. Season 1 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô?you up by Lee dying, and you wondering what will happen to Clementine. Season 2 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• you up by everyone dying except Clementine, and you still wondering what will happen to Clementine. Although, there wasn't a season summary like in Season 1 so I'm waiting for that Episode 6 TellTale.

This isn't just my experience, since many of my friends of quit the game in just a few hours.Game: 9/10 Community: 3/10Overall: 6/10

This is truly the best shooter of 2018. No P2W bullcrap, amazing sound effects, amazing shooting mechanics (there's a fast reload option that drops your mag, what else could you ask for?), good amount of weapons and customization. This game is truly an upgrade from the 2014 Insurgency. I definitely recommend this game.

As someone who has over 2000 hours in DayZ Mod (Although it's not displayed on Steam due to the ability to not play with Steam in DayZ Commander) i can say that this game does not live up to the DayZ Mod standards  (keep in mind that it has been in development for over 5 years). It's lacking vehicles, weapons, helicopters and so on...It has the potential of becoming even better than the Mod, but for now it does not feel like the DayZ I love, there is plenty of work to do, more cars need to be added, the driving needs to be completely reworked because it is truly the worst driving I ever experienced. Plenty of other issues with the current 1.0 build need to be fixed.I truly want this game to prove everyone wrong, but unfortunately, I don't believe it's happening.
Despite all the bugs it's very fun to play with a friend or two.

Introduction:Ori And The Blind Forest ou  OATBF pour les intime, est un jeu de plateforme d√©velopp√©e par Moon et √©diter par Microsoft (vous savez, celui qui a reprit minecraft pour (barrer) rien faire (barrer) ajout√©e des truc sur ce jeu).Sauvons la for√™t....Donc, OATBF est un jeu de plateforme, mais encore, me dirais vous, bah....d√©j√† il y a une histoire.Bienvenue a Nibel, un endroit splendide ou les animaux vive en paix et en harmonie gr√¢ce a un ¬´¬†arbre-m√®re¬†¬ª, un jours, un immense oiseau (une chouette) prend possession de la source de ¬´¬†l'arbre-m√®re¬†¬ª r√©duisant ainsi la for√™t en d√©solation, ou plus de fruit et plante ne poussais, ou les animaux mourait ou se laisse hanter par les t√©n√©bres¬†. vous, oui vous l√†, celui que vous aller jouer, vous √™tes l'un des derniers esprit de l'arbre, recueillie par un une une cr√©ature en manque d'amours, et qui va prendre soin du h√©ros comme son propre enfant, mais le temps passe, et la for√™t d√©p√©ris, tout comme votre ami.Puis votre qu√™te commence, celui de faire rena√Ætre la lumi√®re pour sauver Nibel. Bling Bling for√™tVous vous retrouvez donc au milieu de Nibel a voyager de lieu en lieu, la map est monde ouvert, m√™me si vous aurez besoin de certaine comp√©tence pour progresser vers certain chemin...et aussi de skill, car le jeu a quand m√™me des passage qui sont un peu dur, mais encore heureux, sinon, le jeu serai trop facile, a vous donc de d√©couvrir, fouillez t avoir tout les petit bonus et point d'exp qui vous aiderons dans vos p√©rip√©tie.Exp, j'ai dit¬†? Oui, car, malgr√© le fait que je m'y attendais pas, vous aller devoir terrasser des cr√©ature de la for√™t, sa para√Æt un peu √©trange, de sauver la for√™t en d√©truisant toute forme de vie existante.Cependant , les comp√©tence sont vraiment tr√®s original( comme utiliser un animal pour aller plus haut, ou de faire un saut charger utilisable sur des endroit pentu, etc), bon, on a quand m√™me les basique (telle que le double saut, grimper, etc), le tout reste tr√®s agr√©able, et on ne peut √™tre que admirative sur les d√©cor, des fois, je me suis juste arr√™ter pour regarder le fond, qui sont, franchement r√©ussie, mais avec un sc√©nario aussi po√©tique, fallait s'y attendre, a un truc beau. mes bon ennemis Au fur et a mesure de l'histoire, on comprend beaucoup de chose (comme la motivation du m√©chant, par exemple)Les musique sont elle m√™me tr√®s sympa, m√™me si certaine se font discr√®te, celle du menu est vraiment d'un agr√©able, c'est assez stup√©fiant.Bon, c'est bien jolie tout √ßa, mais il a quand m√™me 2 ou 3 truc que je reproche.-La fin, ou vraiment, sans spoil, j'ai l'impression qu'il ont voulue faire √ßa a la va vite.-a certain moment, on a l'impression que de se contenter a se balader, a buter des ennemis, gagner l'exp, et avoir des point de comp√©tence, etc...c‚Äôest pas pour emb√™ter les d√©veloppeur, mais si vous voulez mon avis, il y a au moins un type assez patient pour se farmer les ennemis et gagner tout les point de comp√©tence au d√©but. conclusionPfff....vraiment, je m'en rend compte, j'ai pas grand chose a dire, et j'ai l'impression que c'est vite fait ce que je dis, mais pourtant, c'est tout ce que j'ai a dire, le jeu a beaucoup d'atout et a peu de probl√®me, a si, je pourrais dire que un LVL ressemble beaucoup au d√©cor de Halo 4, mais c'est Microsoft, je ne suis pas trop √©tonner.Bon bah, perso 7,5/10tr√®s joli, dans tout les sens du terme, m√™me la fin est un poil vite fait et il est tr√®s facile de farmer les ennemis.

Warframe is an instanced game, based around farming and grinding for items, and doesn't seem to have an endgame in sight, simply more and more items being added by devs to farm towards in order to satisfy the veterans.Now, if you enjoy a relatively simple game for an endless timesink, and like the prospect of being able  to boast about your progress to others, then sure, play it.If you don't want an endless timesink, then this isn't for you. It's frustrating, being at the mercy of RNG, don't mistake that.
Many times better than World of Warplanes. Glad they're implementing land and sea units in the same battle, rather than Wargaming's style of separating them all into separate universes.

Has the same charm as the first game, but the levels don't feel as challenging. It has more replay value with added features from updates (such as arcade more). However, I still prefer the first game, as the levels were more fun and challenging. The sequel doesn't have the same level design, I've only struggled a few of the Ying-Yang levels, while most of the Lovely Planet 1's levels were hard.Overall, it's a great game, just not as great as the first.

Oh boy, where do I start? Hotline Miami has done so many things right, everything from its catchy soundtrack, to its simple and addictive gameplay, the variety of weapons, and the suspence of the story. Although I would reccomend playing this with a controller. And the game isn't really that long, takes about 5-6 hours. Which is a good thing in my book.

Do you like to burn things in real life? Do you hate that fact that that is dangerous? if your answer is yes to both question is yes then ...THIS GAME IS MADE FOR YOU, YOU WERE BOOORN TO PLAY THIS GAME !!!all you do is burn stuff, but of course there is a bit more to that then just burning stuff, which you will lern as you play the game.Also there are people that send you letters to make the game a bit more intresting, but still after sometime (and not too long) you will start to lose intrest in the game, because of its repetativness.Overall, it's still a nice relaxing game, it just is more of the same over and over again.

If you are like me and you enjoy 2D platformers then you won't be disapointed.The difeculty if perfect, it isn't too easy so you feel that you accompleshed somethnig, but at the same time it isn't too hard so you don't want to smash your keyboard.Also every level is different with new obsticules and new ways to dodge them.And for some weird reason there is alot of moaning in this game O.oAll in all it's a pretty good platformer and is highly recomended.Edit: forgot to mention that the music is a big part of the game and it's well done.As for the controlls they are pretty simple and effecient :3

A perfect remake to one of Valve's classic favorites, Half-Life. Being the first ever First Person Shooter that involves a deep story involving a silent protagonist, as well as puzzles and scenarios using physics and tactics, it has been an all time favorite for a while now and has been a favorite to many Steam users for years. Black Mesa is a perfect remake in the sense that it increases the graphics without changing the story and the maps too much. If anyone was waiting for a long time for this remake then it definitely was worth the wait. 10/10 remake.

This is the best game about vietnam conflict. Really... There's not a lot of games about this sad war. And even less good games. This game beats rising storm 2 (it's a crap) and vietnam '65 (I Love this one). It's immersive, has a great gameplay and it's innovative! Have you seen any other strategy game about war where you are LITERALLY A COMMANDER and not a ghost flying above the battlefield giving your soldiers orders like a all-seeing god? I thought so! So... If you like history and vietnam era and you like strategy games this one is for you. Great simulation. It even has a voice recognition system.And you can't see your units and enemies. You have to ask them where they are and place them on the map all by yourself. (same with enemies) You can get ambushed at the worst possible moment. It's unpredictable.

Own feelings:This title stole my heart when it appeared on PS4, unfortunately, without a console, I had to be content with watching YouTube videos, but my dream came true on the day of the release of this game on PC.Game description:It is a game that captivates with its story, its main character, whose path from her youth is not easy, decides to change her fate. The game is incredibly addictive, we have many styles of play, we can enter the opponents wreaking havoc or invisibly eliminate all of them in turn. Machines that were a problem, we can subjugate them and order them to fight on our side, which gives a huge range of possibilities.My opinion:I think that the game is great, addictive from the very first minutes I didn't feel like skipping any dialogues despite knowing the whole game. As for the game transferred from the console, the optimization is very good. I do not have a first class computer, it is already several years old, although almost everything on the lowest (medium) settings works and looks satisfactory.

A fun game with a good storyline, but not for everyone. This is a game, in my opinion, intended for people who are not bothered by frequent sneaking and often annoying patterns that need to be overcome. Apparently, we are moving not a heroine who becomes a superhero in a crisis, but a girl who is afraid and not always able to defeat her opponent. If anyone wants to see and play this game, I recommend the easiest difficulty level, which should be pleasant in the implementation of the presented story, I'm not a fan of games in which you have to sneak a lot and do many things quietly, so the average difficulty level is for bothersome me. But in conclusion, I recommend it even because of the plot itself and showing the hero as a really fragile girl who does not become invincible after the first events, but shows this helplessness.

A fun game to play with a lot of potential, its still in development at time of review which is great as the developer will listen to the community and do their best to implement suggestions including mods!Overall, if you like the idea of micromanaging every aspect of a city/country, this is the game for you.

This game is interesting and different from other games, the story is unique and would make a great mini series or film. But as a game, I have to say I just don't enjoy playing it because its simply, boring. You spend the game jogging around collecting parcels off the ground then take them to the right drop off point, that's it... some gun-play later but its a walking sim with some cool cinematic cut scenes attached. When I say walking sim, I mean waaaaalking sim, you walk in essentially real-time, so if you have to go 1 km it will take as long in the game as 1 km would take to walk/jog in real life.On offer with a massive discount its worth playing for a few hours for the novelty factor or if you simply desperately want to burn hours of your life mindlessly, but I would recommend spending your money elsewhere and watching a lets play for the experience.

I want to like this game, I really do... but I don't. The primary reason being it is just too frustrating to play properly! The mechanics of the game (basically everything being equal in power to invasion and war) sound like a good idea, but in practice is results in you "forgetting" things like managing your culture and then losing vast amounts of territories because your "ally" decided to conquer your territory by cultural means instead of open warfare, and as far as I can see, there is no realistic way to counteract it! especially if your territory is surrounded by multiple other empires.Then you have the outpost system... it... is... so... annoying! To turn them into cities costs little for the first city, but after that balloons to what would take over 40 turns of influence points, meanwhile everyone else is turning their outposts into cities seemingly every turn, once again, this is stupid, you should be able to construct cities far easier for the game to actually be interesting and to allow you to build units as only cities can have an army.I have tried now for almost 4 hours to get an understanding of what this game wants, but just as I think i'm doing well it throws a curve ball like having a random unit attack my city from an empire I have a non aggression pact with, then leaving with no mention of what just happened...

I honestly wasn't expecting much from this game given the lukewarm story of Life is Strange 2. And given the sensitive topics and the way issues were handled by the previous game I was expecting more of the same. But this is actually good, really good. It reminds me of how I felt after playing the original life is strange. The characters have depth and feel real, the story has few plot holes and is very well written with any sensitive issues handled with respect and realistically, not just "hillbilly stupid and bad".My only complaint is the use of the powers. It just feels tacked on and is not really necessary to the plot. I feel the game would have actually been better if it had gone down the realism route and just focused on the twins life problems. It doesn't spoil the game, it's just a distraction from the serious plot points.I wish they had the confidence as a studio to accept its OK to have a slice of life game, it doesn't have to be filled with supernatural elements for the sake of it.Overall considering the price and the story you get, this is worth a play. The best game DONTNOD have made for many years, and during an international pandemic no less.

The "game" is interesting... It does play pretty awkward like its been made by a guy who has never been in the same room as a girl let alone dated or been with one. Most of the scenarios are creepy and uncomfortable, you are essentially forcing yourself on the poor girl 90% of the time to "win".What "content" does exist is well animated, I will give them that, but it is only animated. You cant really interact or influence whats happening beyond pushing the correct blue circle. Its a good game and shows what you can do with VR, which is both terrifying and exciting at the same time.If its on sale, its worth getting for the novelty factor. But I wouldn't recommend paying anything above $20.

A great game so far but very short as of May 2020. The devs seem to have a strong interest in completing the game and adding branching story lines. So far I would say the game is unique and very interesting even if short at just under 2 hours. Once they get the time and ability to complete the next episodes (I think they want over 10) the game will be worth a full ¬£50 easily.A solid 8/10 from me and the thing is just getting started.

The game seems like it should be more challenging than it actually is. The game requires you to basically build a fully functioning hospital from the start which both removes the feeling of having progress. The design of the hospital is also pretty limited as you have to keep building multiple of the same room types for each department rather than sharing them such as restrooms and waiting rooms. Overall I feel this game could be so much better if it had more of a prison simulator feel to it.
It may only be ¬£10 but it still is missing a substantial amming kngklfgn rnfir.

I am very 50/50 as to whether this game is "good" or "bad" by steams rating system, honestly I would give it 65/100 if I could but as it costs currently ¬£40 I have to side with "bad".The game is fun if you like mindless violence and watching bullets tear through soldiers, it gives you a few hours of enjoyment. However this is also the con as the majority of the game is based around this mindless violence concept of bullet time, after you've watched this animation for the 50th time the effect gets dull and repetitive and then you start to notice the story, or rather lack of one along with the AI which seems completely stupid and only around to catch the bullets you fire like a live firing range. As other reviewers have said, if you have played the last Sniper elite titles this is no more than an expansion pack on those.The basic premise of this game is a chapter based story mode, you are in random large maps and given seemingly random and repetitive missions, "blow him up", "kill him", "blow this thing up", it gets dull by the third map because their doesn‚Äôt seem to be any point beyond "see how far away I can kill this Nazi". This would be ok if you had to use strategy, however the AI is so dumb even on hardest difficulty you loose immersion by how stupid they are.Also day one DLC's are a big no for me for a ¬£40 game (along with showing them in the game as something you think you can unlock through hard play).If I could sum this game up in a few words it would be Hitman but with stupider AI and less kill options, yet that game got "bad" ratings and this is "very good"... shows what marketing can do.

This is my second and updated review for Batman, lets get stuck in.Unfortunately I still give this game a regrettable "negative", I want to give it a positive but just when I think they have finally fixed the performance issues they raise their ugly head again (in chapter 3 the lip sync is out by around 3-5 seconds for at least 10 minutes of gameplay), the stuttering is still present and seems to be caused by the engine just being unable to load all the "detail" in the game world (it looks like a game from 2010, cant be too difficult in 2016).The performance issues aren‚Äôt a massive disincentive however, the real issue I have is with the story in general or rather the seemingly lack of "multiple choice", for instance in no particular order:1) Characters keep telling you off for hurting or even murdering people despite the fact I have gone out of my way to be a "good guy" and not hurt or kill anyone (they try and push in the game its the media manipulating people, I think its them being lazy and not coding the events properly, case example a cop telling me off for seriously injuring a suspect despite the fact he should know I didn't).2) Choices you make seem to always lead to the same outcome regardless, more so than other games telltale have made, it makes the experience very linear.3) This is a big one and a *spoiler*, ties into point 2..... at the end of chapter 3 you have the option to give a good speech, political and not rise to the level of the penguin, needless to say the game ends with you going crazy due to a drug injection completely undoing all the careful political manoeuvring you did for the whole episode, showing how next episode you end up hated by everyone and put in an asylum for being insane... nice multiple choice their telltale, would love to see how you integrate my past choices into that one, why did I even bother?Overall I get the distinct feeling to get the most out of this game you have to play as if batman has an existential crisis of identity and wants to go to the low levels of the bad guys, all the dialogue seems to point to that and I think if you enjoy that side of batman (eg not being batman at all) the game would make a lot more sense.I will keep playing because its a good way to waste a few hours, I know my choices result in little but at least it is enjoyable.Overall 6/10, ok but I would wait until its on offer.
Really cool, and climatic game. Love it!
